Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BJC12345
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean, and an amazing location. My room was a little crammed against another building, but a good size and pretty nice. Staff was very accomodating. It was great to be on the hill next to China Town, Top of the Mark and the Tonga Room. In the end would recommend highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location--great value”
Reviews.Author: Rick J
Reviews.Content: Got a terrific rate on this fine hotel, and enjoyed our long weekend stay immensely. Room was nicely sized. clean and beautifully decorated, with a comfortable (requested) King -sized bed with great pillows. Fine quality overall, made all the more enjoyable given the price and location. Short walk to Chinatown, Union Square, Grace Cathedral. Next door to the Top of the Mark (for high afternoon tea or drinks) and across the street from the Fairmont's Tonga Room. Cable cars at your doorstep (North Beach restaurants are a reasonable downhill walk, nice cable car ride uphill "home"). Service was great. Did hear the cable cars a bit (we were on the "outside", but not on the street side), but didn't bother us. TV great, chair lacked supportive padding. In room coffee great, room service and minibar prices borderline outrageous (no nearby cafe's or breakfast spots that we noticed). Shower water pressure weak, and shower head low. Didn't use the on-site bar/restaurant (looked attractive). Having stayed on Union Square and near Fisherman's Wharf, I would come back to this Nob Hill location and recommend it highly to all, if the price is/stays right for you.

Reviews.Title: “Simply delightful, elegant, wonderful service and ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: janetraveller
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times in the past two years and we always have a lovely room, comfortable, quiet...one time we had a room overlooking California and it was a tad noisy with the cable cars but overall nicely appointed, spacious, clean rooms and comfy beds.On our most recent visit the hotel accommodated a late request for a room with two beds, high floor and quiet and we overlooked an interior courtyard - perfect. Reception is always friendly as were all staff members we encountered. Breakfast was quite good although there are numerous, fabulous restaurants every where you turn so I'd recommend dining out. Back to the room - the beds were very comfortable, clean and lots of pillows. The bathroom had a sliding door and separate toilet/shower room. Long vanity and sink area with hanging space at the end - it worked well for two people.The location is really perfect since you walk out of the hotel and turn right a few steps to one of the main line cable cars. Or, you can simply walk down to the wharf - a great walk and leads you right to an incredible farmer's market. Take the cable car back up the hill or a cab. I took a cable car very back from North Beach quite late and felt very safe. The hotel also has a workout area and a business center. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Can Get a Good Rate, Extras a La Carte”
Reviews.Author: Bryce S
Reviews.Content: Travelled to SF for a long weekend. Hotel has a great location atop Nob Hill at California and Powell Streets. Two cablecar lines intersect. The rooms are to the high quality you expect from Marriott/Renissance brands. The rooms are large. Seven pillows, comfy beds. Concierge Lounge closed on weekends which is understandable. No coffee in lobby. You can buy it at the bar. Business center closed until 8:00 AM on Monday. Internet connection available in lobby, $ 7.50 for the first 15 minutes. They are little things but they detract from the Marriott "we love our Rewards Member" experience. Oddly it did not feel like it had a lobby - friends explained it was an apartment building at some point in the past, then convetred to a hotel. That would explain the low ceilings on the ground floor. Very little to compain about, it's just not the perfect Marriott experience you come to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: slolucky
Reviews.Content: Our family of three stayed here in March 2012 for the weekend. Good rates, friendly and excellent service, delicious bed, great clean, quiet and pretty room....close to everything and staff was helpful with taxis and directions. Also ate at their restaurant and ordered room service....very good food and prices were average and expected. Good value for rate/money and we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: BeachLover077
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night for business trip, and it also happened to be my first time to San Francisco. It's a great location for seeing the city and a very nice hotel. The room was a decent size as was the bathroom. They free wireless in the lobby and some very nice loungy couches to relax on if you choose to go there to use us. The lobby opens up to a restaurant/bar which had a nice buzz of people conducting meetings, using there computers with a cocktail, or just hanging out. The hotel is only 3 blocks from the upscale shopping area (Union Square) and right on the crossroads of the 2 cable car lines. You can jump on the Powell line from the corner and ride down to Fisherman's Pier. It's also walkable. The Fairmont across the street is home to the Tonga Room - a restaurant worth visiting. I would stay at this hotel again next time in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Very very very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danthemannad
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an outstanding hotel. We were on a business trip as a group. We were served as kings. People were smiling, customer orientated, great restaurant in the hotel. Cable car were passing in front of the hotel. When getting in the rooms, a great ambiance music is awaiting, the bead spread was open a bit with great milk chocolate and bottle of wine. The warmth welcoming of this hotel is really outstanding and more than what expected. Would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott experience, with cable car access you can't beat!”
Reviews.Author: lauranlauren
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful getaway weekend atop Nob Hill ... at an amazing price of only $151 per night, booked just a few days before our trip. This hotel is great if you seek quiet, class and a location that"s special, but not in the middle of tourist chaos ... at a very affordable price if you time it right. It is a Marriott, which we love ... but not a typical Marriott. The location is wonderful if you love cable car fun ... it stops right outside the door, at the top of the hill. Cool ride to Fishermans Wharf and back. It's also Chinatown close, if you can handle the steep walk (we like to walk down to dinner, cab back as our midwestern girl is not a hill hiker). Staff is respectful, and you won"t find the usual tumble of kids ... it is definitely a grownup hotel. Old historic type property with hip decor. No pool. We had several lovely sightsee/hike/scenery days followed by beautiful afternoon naps, followed by fun dinner out. Now, taxes and parking ($52) are the usual San Fran awful ... and food and bev at the hotel are pricey. However, if you just use it for lodging and rest, you cant beat the Stanford Court.

Reviews.Title: “Great value on Nob Hill. New hotel.”
Reviews.Author: nevels2000
Reviews.Content: In my business life I am a Marriott guy. However, I usually like to try something different when I travel on my own dime. I can say that every time I come back to San Francisco (which is every August for the OutsideLands Music Festival) I will stay here. Nicely remodeled rooms and great service. I got a suite overlooking the Bay Bridge and it was fantastic. Perfect location if you are looking for a quiet neighborhood but close to all of the action of Union Sq. I would say this is the best value I have found in SF and I would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: matthewa330
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located for either business or pleasure. It is just a short walk to Union Square or a short cable car ride to Fisherman's Wharf. The rooms are clean and comfortable and full of amenities. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful throughout my short two night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Angela W
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel with nice rooms and a very comfortable bed. The check-in staff are very friendly as well as efficient. The bathroom is modern and I love the Aveda toiletries. The concierge really knows his way around good restaurants. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, spacious rooms, on a hill though!”
Reviews.Author: Serial_Shopper2010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, parking is about $60, but secure and they are quick to get your car for you. Very friendly check in staff, gave us a great room on the corner of the bulding (bigger than the other rooms) Our room was a twin, 2 huge doubles, very comfy, mattress toppers, best nights sleep ive had in a while! Bathroom clean with a nice little walk in waldrobe and dressing area. Internet was $15 for 24 hours, however because we are Marriott timeshare holders the concierge waived this for us (always worth asking). Situated in the beautiful Nob Hill area, 5 minute walk (steep hill!) or tram ride down to Union Square and Macy's. Great Irish pub on O'Farrell down the road (great beers, lively atmosphere, have the wings!). Overall a fantastic property, beautiful building, great staff, perfect location. Worth staying on this side of town rather than Fisherman's Wharf which is a bit grotty.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a conference - Be prepared for a bit of walking”
Reviews.Author: sd_in_switzerland
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Renaissance for a conference I organized. In terms of the conference facilities and the hotel staff, I have nothing but the top level of praise. The staff were organized, helpful, pleasant and responsive -- on multiple levels. I would come here again for that alone. The rooms were also lovely with some wonderful pillows. I was sadly unable to spend much time in the room because I was so busy! They also brought in a fridge at my request and did not charge for it, which was particularly nice. I also enjoyed the gym, which was not huge but really did the trick. The only downside was, if you didn't want to eat at the hotel, you needed to do a bit of walking to find a place to eat. But given the central location and the value of walking for your heart, I very much enjoyed this. There are other good hotels around the area and Union Square, but if you can get a good deal on this hotel, I encourage people to try it. It is very much worth a stay for the customer service alone.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: PennStateGirl05
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel in the middle of San Francisco based on its location, TripAdvisor reviews and its rate (179.00). Being a light sleeper and someone who has trouble falling asleep with noise, I was a little anxious about the reviews that mentioned noise. I called the hotel directly to ask for a quiet room and then later called to make sure they had noted that request. We were not disappointed; a room on the inside facing the courtyard was perfect for us, and both my husband and I slept better in this hotel than we have anywhere else. NOTE: If you are facing the streets - even the non-cable car streets - you WILL hear a ton of street noise, including the incredibly loud cable cars and taxi summoning whistles. It's just a busy spot. The rooms, although small, are very nicely appointed with an extremely comfortable bed and even windows that open for some fresh air. The number one positive about this hotel, though, is the service. The attitudes of the employees at this hotel are wonderful and welcoming. The front door is opened every time you approach it, you are greeted warmly by every employee, and any request is filled almost instantly. On top of the incredibly welcoming atmosphere, the location makes Union Square, Fisherman's Wharf, and many other spots very walkable (just get ready for the hills). For dinner one night we walked about two blocks to the Nob Hill Cafe, which is a tiny neighborhood spot serving mostly Italian dishes. The food was fine, but nothing to rave about. Other nights we walked down into North Beach, which is only about a 15 minute walk. We did not try the hotel restaurant, but there were many options within a few minutes for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Overall, the hotel itself was one of the best parts of our second trip to this lovely city. I loved this hotel and hope we can go back again someday!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced (no surprise), Unclean (big surprise)”
Reviews.Author: Brett W
Reviews.Content: Now, don't get wrong. I'm not naive in terms of room rates and I fully expected to pay through the teeth for a room in San Francisco during a medical convention. So bear in mind that my rate was $499.00 per night, originally planned for 3 consecutive nights. Beyond the antiquated decor and carpeting throughout the hotel, and the fact that the amenities were limited to shampoo, conditioner and body lotion, I didn't expect the following: - whitish stains on the chair and the work area (let your mind wander, mine did) - yellow stains on the roof of the bathroom above the shower - hairs stuck on the bathroom ceiling and walls - minibar was broken with no ETA for a fix ("they will get to it sometime soon") To me this says laziness. Just how complacent is the housekeeping standard monitoring for these sort of items to go overlooked. 2 of the 3 take time to develop, and it's my opinion that they were known, yet simply untended. Sorry, no second chances here - these are simply inexcusable. In the end, I checked out after the first night and stayed at the Fairmont which was right across the street and $50 less per night. Great stay - go there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: ct3408
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this hotel and it is my choice when in sfo. Convenient to all points in city, both cable car lines meet outside, very clean, friendly staff, rooms very comfortable. Modern interior, but bright and airy. If the bells of the cable cars are too noisy, request a room on the interior. You lose the view, which is often very nice, but gain some quiet. I enjoy the views and don't mind the mild sounds of the city. I'm a light sleeper, but never have trouble getting to bed. Concierge lounge is small, but comfortable and good choices of food. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation in SF”
Reviews.Author: Mom1002
Reviews.Content: Great location for our family of 6. We were given a corner room with two beds connecting with a king room. It was a perfect set up with our 4 kids. Every morning we would stroll across the street for a great cup of coffee and then go and sit in the park to watch Tai Chi (also a small playground where the kids could run a bit). I cannot say enough about the actual location on Nob Hill which was ideal in so many ways with the cable cars running right past the hotel. Although there was maintenance and all lines weren't running, it still was fine. We walked a lot and were always so happy when we retuned to our peacful hill top oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely smaller hotel on Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: TravelingWren
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night in January - I think we had an upgraded room, two queens, a day-bed, a view of some San Francisco type dormered buildings across the street and a distant view of the bay and the lighted hills at night. Very good value for the area, pleasant and comfortable with a splendid friendly staff. Nice lounge where we had wine and delicious snacks - did not eat in their restaurant but think it is probably good judging from the quality of the "starters" in the bar. Highly recommend. Close to cable cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelConnoisseurs
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is lovely. The lobby atmosphere isn't as warm as it could be, but the staff will make up for the stark decor. The views from Nob Hill are tremendous and it is an easy walk downhill to Union Square and not too bad walking back up.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: KTITA
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a weekend in SanFran and was very pleased with my choice. The staff is friendly and helpful, got some good tips from concierge and I had a great time in town, as always! The hotel is nicely located at Nob Hill, which is a lovely neighborhood, with easy access to other fun places in town.The room was clean and well maintained and had a nice city view. To my surprise, it was quiet - despite the connecting door, which I try to avoid the best I can at hotels, but this time they were pretty booked, so not many room options. My friend stayed here too and she also liked it. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable older style property”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravellers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights while in town for work. The hotel is comfortable, the room was nice and the bed and bedding were great. The chair in the room, like the ones in the lobby, was too straight backed for comfort and the shower head(which had an extender pipe on it) was still too low for me. The original outlet for the shower hit me in mid chest. The hike to the top of Nob Hill is taxing, but it is a wonderful location to use as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: MissingVermont
Reviews.Content: As a weary traveller, I was relieved to pull into the parking area at the Stanford Court, where I was greeted by a friendly, helpful valet. The Reception was warm, friendly and super efficient. My room was exceptionally clean and nicely laid out with plenty of room to get comfortable. Room service was fast and the food was delcious. The bed was the most comfortable bed ever! I CANNOT say enough about this hotel. I would go back in a heartbeat. The location was nice, too with pretty views of the bay and city. Trolley car intersects at the hotel and taxi cabs were readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely views, Noisy to Folks Not Used to Cities”
Reviews.Author: MarcB13
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, if a bit cold. The staff and food in the restaurant was excellent. The parking is prohibitively expensive and even though we phoned the attendants 30 minutes before picking up our car, it took another 45 before it was delivered. We were "upgraded" to a room with a view - but it was extremely small and extremely noisy. We were on the sixth floor, but the cable cars ring every few minutes until a rather late shut down time. I would ask for a quieter room on a return visit. The location IS great for walking the streets. Be sure to take the few steps to Grace Cathedral. It is gorgeous and has two labrynths and a rose window worth viewing.

Reviews.Title: “A class hotel in the midst of great hotels”
Reviews.Author: traveltime54
Reviews.Content: The Stanford Court is a classic hotel that exudes class and style. As a platinum elite Marriott member we decided that our 5 day stay in this great hotel was a must. We were not disappointed. We were given an excellent room with a wonderful view of both the city buildings, and the San Francisco Bay. Who could ask for anything more. All of our requirements were there on check-in, and the room was fresh and super clean. From a location point of view you cannot do any better in the downtown area. We had breakfast every morning in the hotel restaurant, and with the watchful and superb service by Ramon we enjoyed well cooked and executed dishes. I also commend the very exacting and efficient housekeeping staff, Anna in the concierge lounge, and Ann Merek, the Director of Operations, who ensured that our stay was ultimately a superb one. Because of the fact that the Stratford is located on the corner of Powell and California one hears the cable cars, with bells and all, until 1AM in the morning. It did disturb some of our sleep, and might affect others similarly. Just thought I'd mention that for those who are very noise conscious. If we travel through San Francisco again this will be our hotel home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, good location, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pierre758
Reviews.Content: We were delighted by the welcome we received and the helpfulness of the staff. We were shown 3 rooms - all light and clean and a good size for the location. Excellent value for money particularly for the location - virtually opposite The Fairmont and half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mathmom525
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent trip to San Francisco with my daughter. The staff was accommodating, the bedding lush and the room meticulously clean. Would absolutely recommend this hotel and will stay there again when I visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravellerVA
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel because of the location near Nob Hill and the Cable Cars. The Hotel has a european feel - you drive into an off-street court yard to the front entry. We enjoyed the Hotel Restaurant that had an excellent menu. The service from our waiter was very good and he recommended a lovely wine. We are looking forward to going back for another romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: Rebecky75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Stanford Court in October 2011 for a five-night getaway. The location is outstanding - on Nob Hill right at the intersection of two cable car lines, a short walk to Chinatown. The staff all went out of their way to be helpful. We had a beautiful room with a view of the bay and Alcatraz. The furnishings and linens are high-end. If you have access to the concierge lounge, it provides amazing views, as well as a quality breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Lasrman
Reviews.Content: This is located right on Nob Hill in the center of things. It is on two cable car runs so you can get anywhere. We thought the staff was really nice and helpful. We had a room which overlooks the open central core so it was very quiet. The room furnishings were clean and attractive. The only thing I could say negative is that the our room was rather small (12' x 15'?) with an additional bathroom/closet/vanity area off one side just nig enough to open one suitcase in the closet. You have to pay for internet if you are not a Gold member of their frequent traveller club. If you are there's also a nice 6th floor lounge with a view and snacks in the evening and breakfast in the morning. Parking is pricey at $48/night and only valet. .

Reviews.Title: “Marriott standard...”
Reviews.Author: KatRossaNYC
Reviews.Content: this hotel did not stand out among other Marriott hotels. The room was elegant and medium in size with clean linens and comfy bed. Nothing outstanding. The location is very convenient to everything downtown. I would probably stay here again unless I found a better deal/value somewhere else :)

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Hill”
Reviews.Author: Ms-Etiquette
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Stanford Court was a beautiful property. The rooms were lovely, the bed was comfortable and the service was great. Although the location was in walking distance to many things including Union Square, Chinatown, and theatres, we found ourselves walkiing up and down the hill to get to heart of the action. At $6 per person, the cable cars are too expensive to go just a few short blocks. Cabs were a better bet, but to go just 5 blocks seemed excessive. My verdict... I would rather stay at the Marriott which was closer to Union Square. There is also a nice Kimpton hotel across from the Marriott. If you would like a quieter, more boutique style stay, definintley go with the Renaissance. Just bring your walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Super nice...”
Reviews.Author: Jenkd59
Reviews.Content: Wonderful is all I can say. Good service, great view and comfortable bed!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in central location”
Reviews.Author: JennyG123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights while touring San Francisco. The hotel was centrally located â€“ and a great home base for visiting the sites. As a Marriott Rewards member, we stayed here on points. Despite arriving at the hotel after its stated check in time, our room was still not ready. An hour later â€“ and after multiple inquiries, our room was ready. The room was very well appointed, clean and comfortable. Some of the other reviews speak of the street noise â€“ however, we had no problem with noise since our room was on the second floor â€“ and faced the courtyard below. Although we didnâ€™t have the beautiful views of the higher level rooms, we still had a limited view of the area. All in all, we would definitely stay here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: kiyeran
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It had a very nice layout and looks very pretty. It's very close to the Union Square, Chinatown, and Japantown, so it was a plus for me. The only thing is that it is on top of a hill, so you can get an exercise if you are coming back from the Union Square. But there's a cable car right in front of the hotel, so that's good. Overall, it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location With Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Des1Edmonton_Alberta
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference in San Francisco and had a reduced rate so stayed at the Conference Hotel Renaissance Stanford Court. Perfectly fine in terms of cleanliness, quite floor, bathroom amenities, decor etc. Towel warmer in bathroom is ineffective but nothing significantly bothersome about the room itself. But the best part is the location. Easy cab ride to Fisherman's Wharf, only $10.00 or less, or a short downhill walk to Union Square for lots of shopping, restaurant or city life action. I never even ate at the hotel once, as I had heard from other conference attendees the food prices were expensive. The concierge is top notch in helpfulness and guidance. If you know sort of what you want to do he will provide best options and help make reservations. Check out the Tongo room at the Fairmont Hotel across the street for Happy Hour cocktails with appetizers or go up the hill a little to the Top of the Mark Lounge at another hotel for drinks, a great view and ambience. We enjoyed live jazz and were entertained by guests swing dancing to the music. The hotel is on a steep hill so be prepared to cab home or take the street car, leave the heels at home this is not a city for heels! All in all a nice retreat from the noise of the downtown area if the room rate fits your budget.

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars Good Price on Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: Hoosierdad
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Priceline.com for $125 per night. We got a great deal. This hotel is in a great location right across from a trolley stop. We only stayed 2 days, but would have enjoyed a longer stay. The Hotel Staff were exceptional, especially the bar tender. He was very friendly and gave us excellent advice and directions. It is a short walk down hill to great shopping, and about a 25 minute walk to the wharf. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Second Visit--Terrific Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: monte5
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at the Stanford Court to celebrate a birthday---we were not disappointed--once again the staff was "superb"-- Ms.Ann Marek front office manager is on top of the operation--assisted by Emad, Rochelle, Jarrett, they make everything work and work well---Ric Lee Conceirge is one of the best--he knows San Francisco--Bellman Joshua a native New Yorker is a real plus for this hotel--Mark Gleason wine sommelier and restaurant manager is an added plus

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: MrsWickerSwansea
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to San Francisco and we werent disappointed. The Stanford Renaissance was absolutely wonderful. The staff at the hotel were exceptionally helpful from beginning to end of trip. Special thanks to the reception staff who ordered us a pizza after a few late nights drinks! The rooms were well executed and comfortable, the bed on the smaller size for the USA in my experience! We were on the courtyard side of the hotel which was a shame but didnt detract from the experience. We could hear the city noise but that only added to our great experience. The Hotel is situation at the top of Nob Hill, which we expected to be quite a walk up from Union Square but in all honesty it was no hardship to walk back after frequenting the bars and restaurants at both Fishermans Wharf and Union Square. If you want to full San Francisco experience I would thoroughly recommend staying at this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “our choice time over time”
Reviews.Author: CMM-LA
Reviews.Content: we go to san francisco quite a bit and have stayed at various places around nob hill and union square, but we finally settled on going back to this location time after time. I wish I'd known about this place before our wedding because I dropped thousands for guest rooms at Hotel Nikko and didn't get any points- the Stanford Court is on the Marriott program and has a very good points system and is just as nice. the staff is friendly, it's central (if you don't mind the huge hill) and the rooms are small but always clean and very well appointed. If you are sensitive to noise don't get an outside/street facing room or the street cars and sirens will drive you crazy. the courtyard rooms are quieter. personally, we don't mind the noise as it's offset by the view. even the lower rooms have a nice city view. no free wifi except in the lobby, which is annoying when you are paying this much for a hotel. the rooms are not cheap but are usually in line with other hotels of the same quality in the area. parking, like in all of SF, runs about $50 a night and is valet only, but the valets are prompt and helpful and we've never had any issues with damage to our car, etc. if you are on a budget you might be able to find parking off site in another lot, but you won't save very much and you won't have in/out privilages, which the hotel gives you.

Reviews.Title: “Our first choice in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: strawberryroan
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed here was at the recommendation of a friend. The experience was so positive that we've been back twice and it is our first choice while staying in San Francisco. We never rent a car--always use public transportation when in the city and this hotel is right at the cross-roads of two cable car lines. From there you can walk, take buses, ride the cable car--it is just incredibily convenient. The rooms are very comfortable; the staff goes out of their way to be helpful; the concierge never seems to get tired of answering questions. It's a wonderful hotel and we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel - Great Service - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mjgboston
Reviews.Content: I stay here year after year. Perfect location - just up the hill from Union Square. Excellent service - comfortable rooms. A little noise from the Cable Car moving up an California Street but not enough to keep you awake. Good bar, lounge, room service and restaurant. The Dungeness crab cakes are pretty good! Staff seems proud to work there. They extend themselves to their guests. Has an "almost" five-star feel for four-star prices. Often able to get rooms at real bargain rates on line. This time I paid about $400. Renovated quite a few years ago with a bright boutique look to the hallways. Almost time for another renovation. Clean and well maintained. My TV screen wouldn't light up and an engineer appeared in my room in minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Option in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: pwierz
Reviews.Content: We had an nice stay at the Renaissance Stanford Court. It met all of our needs. The location is great in Union Square and the view from the room was terrific (see pic). The staff was polite and the hotel was very clean. In regards to the street noise that a lot of other reviewers are commenting on, I understand where they are coming from. The noise from the cable cars is noticeable but not unbearably loud. If you are a moderate to heavy sleeper, you will be fine. If you are a light sleeper, you may want to get an interior room (or go to a different hotel). One other important note is that this hotel is at the very top of Nob Hill so you will have a pretty steep climb any time you walk back to the hotel from any direction (see pic) but you can just take the $6 cable car (less if you get a multi-day pass) instead. Even if you're in peak physical form, don't try to carry your luggage from the BART station to the hotel. You will regret it. One tip if you are staying on the weekend, there is a parking garage two blocks from the hotel at the corner of Bush and Stockton that costs $10 overnight and $8 all day Sunday which is far less than the ridiculous $54 parking at the hotel. Pros: Well maintained with a good staff Great location near Union Sq Easy access to the Cable Cars Excellent workout facilities Cons: A bit of a hike (1-1.5 miles) from the other touristy spots like Fisherman's Wharf and the Alcatraz Ferries Exorbitant parking Some street noise Top of a steep hill

Reviews.Title: “We Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rtdFirenze_Italy
Reviews.Content: Okay we admit it.... very biased about this hotel. Love everything about it. An old dowager queen type place, busy, busy, busy!!! Lots of activity and yet surprisingly quiet in your rooms. One time we had a problem with noise between the doors (we were in a suite) at night. But only this one time and oddly it would not deter us from staying again. Four visits in four months....16 days total. So we must have enjoyed it! Wonderful gym, the lounge upstairs has a great host in the morning and a woman in the evening who has been with marriott for years and seems to know everyone. The GM greets you by name, the concierges are the best in the industry and although you better be in darn good walking condition to get up to this hotel....there are taxis easily available. We could stay anywhere because there are many options in SF, but for some reason we find this hotel charming and extremely well-run. RTD

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: Buffalogirl41
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Stanford Court for a wedding. We were able to walk to Fisherman's wharf, China Town, and Nob Hill - it was a great location. The room was very nice - spacious and well appointed. The bed was very comfortable and the sitting area was a nice touch. Hotels in Nob Hill are very expensive and the Marriott was a little more reasonable, but with all the same benefits. We enjoyed room service and the food was great with lots of options. I highly recommend this hotel to travelers who want great customer service and an amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Deborah K
Reviews.Content: We stayed here four nights for a family vacation. The hotel was very nice, very clean, comfortable, gracious and accommodating. Reasonably priced for what was quite luxurious. We had a lovely and large room with two double beds and a roll away - a nice western view. Small lobby and public areas, but we spent no time there. Everyone was friendly and helpful including housekeeping and doormen. Everyone offered good advice when asked, from car service to somewhere to get a late night bite, or dessert. Right on two cable car lines, buses and cabs readily available as well. Centrally located, financial district, Union Square and China Town just down the hill. Perfect for us. Some commented on street noise - that is true - but true of all city hotels. We were very happy. Thank you Stanford Court!

Reviews.Title: “Initial trouble at check in - but overall excellent.”
Reviews.Author: Amy_Lea_10
Reviews.Content: We had a bit of bother when we first checked in - they didn't have a reservation for us. its unclear if this was the fault of Virgin who we booked with or the hotel. Either way - they gave us a room in the end and we were impressed. It was snug, very clean modern and the bed was exceptionally comfy. There was a little bit of noise from the cable car but I loved this - its the sound of San Francisco and now that I am home I miss it a bit. The hotel is in a great location - right at the top of two cable car runs down to Union Square and Market Street and down to Fishermans Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC SERVICE GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: sand_davemc
Reviews.Content: you will find this place at the top of Nob Hill,wow great staff good rooms well priced,clean,fantasic food.The hotel is located right on the main tram line for Union Square,and for fishermans wharf.I went in blind booking this hotel from Australia,and there was so many to choose from but i'm clad we stayed where we did.From the bell men to the girls on the front desk to the waiter's in there restaurant top service, friendly,and nothing was ever to much trouble.The rooms are older style but very very comfortable.Dont be scared to use the tram or trolly as the call it.At $6 one way or $14 all day travel take the $14 its great value and a great way to see the city,and run from 6am to 12 midnight.Have fun because San Fran is a great place and heaps to see.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Midan99
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, but a bit Noisy. Hear cable car, neighbour room people speaking and people on floor. Thin walls. Service ok if tipped ...... Good location on top with cable car stations in front

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: DWM64
Reviews.Content: We paid top price, but thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Reception staff, and conciege were helpful, informative and friendly. The food was expensive, but we dined in the restaurant one evening, and had a lovely meal, with a great wine. Staff were great. The bar was good, too. The room was beautifully appointed, and we slept really well. Situation on the top of Nob Hill was actually ideal - cable car just outside, and an easy taxi ride up the hills.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel on nob hill”
Reviews.Author: Chelsea33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in late August while on a family trip to SF. We got a great rate online and the hotel surpassed our expectations. I requested a room with a view during check-in and at first they said these rooms had special rates and were sold out. But the helpful check-in person did manage to find us a nice room on a higher floor with a good view. The location is noisy, so request a higher floor. I was not crazy about the location because it was on top of a steep hill--so you have to be in shape to climb it. Also, there are a lot of surrounding hotels nearby, but very few places restaurants not associated with hotels. One evening we literally went walking looking for a place to eat and then ended up back at the hotel because we couldn't find a restaurant. The hotel restaurant was just okay for dinner and it was pricey. Overall I would recommend this hotel --it's a solid 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: FTLAW
Reviews.Content: Stayed with the family. The hotel has a nice driveway entrance. The hotel itself is at the top of nob hill. We found going up and down the hill actually enjoyable. The cable car line does go right by the hotel. The staff was not overly friendly. We had two beds in our room and it was rather cramped. The beds were pretty comfortable. Our view was over an ugly courtyard. I asked for a high floor as a gold member and was given one of the lower floors without explanation. Small bathroom with little privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great Chef”
Reviews.Author: TDK1009
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel twice. The first time I wasn't as fond of the stay because I was in a very large room by myself. My 2nd stay resulted because the hotel I was to stay in had several rooms flooded from children setting off the sprinklers from having a pillow fight. (Only mention because it caused serious problems for this hotel) My luck was it all worked out, I was in a very quaint room that the bedding was so lush and comfy. The chef prepared great dishes for the days that I was there without garlic due to my allergy. I'm traveling back and look forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute perfection in the City by the Bay”
Reviews.Author: ehdailey
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, this hotel was absolutely perfect. I'm basing my assessment on location, amenities and room comfort but it was the little things more than anything else that made this such a wonderful experience. Firstly, the location. It's set at the top of Powell on the corner of California. You're steps away from Union Square, Chinatown, Pacific Heights, you name it. You can walk practically anywhere. And if you don't feel like hoofing it up the hill you can catch any one of the streetcars that ramble up from below. (Personally, I like walking up the hills as it's great for burning off various meals partaken of in Chinatown or SOMA.) Amazing restaurants within a five-block-radius. There's even a little liquor/food store just down the street on Powell that has wine and cheese and fruit and other sundry items (I picked up water and nuts and wine) so you don't have to crack into the minibar. Secondly, the amenities. From the gorgeous bar/restaurant to the comfortable lounge to the well-appointed rooms, this hotel delivers the goods. The bar was a great place to relax at the end of the day. With excellent wine selections from local wineries and delicious freshly-made cocktails as well as great bar snacks, I found myself ending up there by choice every evening. The restaurant was also fantastic -- and the same food delivered to your room was so far from typical room service fare that I elected to order in at least twice while I was there. The gym was great and rarely full (I didn't go during heavy activity times, yes, but still). Thirdly, the room comfort. Every aspect of these rooms are lovely. I stayed there twice in the same week but several days apart due to my travel schedule. The first two nights I was in a 7th floor room on California. Great views of the bay and street below. The bed is unreal. Like sleeping in a pillow. I asked for extra down pillows and they were waiting for me when I arrived. There are Aveda products in the bathroom and a fabulous shower. Slept like a baby. On the second stay, I was on the 4th floor over Powell. Beautiful bay windows and a nice view. Yes, the noise from the streetcars is terrible. But I knew that going in -- I wanted the view and that comes with a price. If you want the same comfort but a quieter stay, request a room on the inside. No view but infinitely quieter. Or you can do what I did and bring earplugs and a white noise app for your phone :). But really, it was the small touches that make me want to come back -- like the doorman remembering me whenever I returned and the front desk staff bringing water to waiting patrons and the bartenders remembering which wine I liked (the Napa Groth -- and this was only after having visited the bar twice!) and the general friendliness of every single staff member. The entire package made it a memorable stay. One that I'd love to repeat any time I'm in San Francisco! One negative note: WiFi is not free in the rooms. It's $14.95/24 hours. As a luxury/business hotel, Internet should absolutely be free -- if we're spending time in the city and in our rooms doing business, we shouldn't have to pay for internet every night. Just one little negative in a review full of positives!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sbhudson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the absolute PERFECT location. The cable car picks up right out front and will take either to Union Square or to Fishermans Wharf! It was a nice hotel! There were three of us girls that stayed in the room...two double beds. Beds weren't the most comfortable but they were fine. Only problem we found was that the bathroom was just a tad too small (to be getting ready at the same time) and the shower head was made for someone who was 4 feet tall (poor planning). Nice TV and loved the reading lights on both sides of each bed. The hotel bar could have had better service....2 of 2 times that we were there...it was terrible service. But they had a great drink/cocktail selection and good menu. Received EXCELLENT service from Ric (concierge) and from Josh (bellman). I highly recommend this hotel for location, location, location! By the way, we also walked both too and from Union Square. It's only about 4 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Cable Cars Were Very Noisy”
Reviews.Author: maisany
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a priceline reservation for three nights at the end of a weeklong vacation trip. Over the years, I have stayed at the other two Nob Hill "grande dame" hotels -- the Fairmont and the Mark Hopkins, and I would include the Stanford Court in the same category. When I arrived, I was offered a queen room with a "better view" than the king room that had been set aside for me. I assumed that this was a win-win, but as it turned out, it was a mixed blessing. True, the room I ended up with had very nice views, and I assume that the room that I had been given was an interior room with no views at all, but the views came at a cost. The Stanford Court faces Powell Street, which is the one that the two of the three cable cars run on. The room they gave me was right over the Powell Street side, and on a lower floor (3rd), so the cable cars going by, ringing their bells at every stop, were quite noticeable during their operating hours. For a city dweller, this was a minor annoyance, but for someone from more quiet surroundings might find this rather disturbing. Just a word of caution. Otherwise, the room was very well furnished, with a very firm and comfortable bed, a large flat-screen TV and a writing desk and small chair and table. The room was small but not claustrophobic, and the bathroom/closet was laid out intelligently, allowing for two guests to be using different parts of the layout in succession. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. I was even able to save a little time and effort by purchasing my Transit Pass from the front desk, rather than from the Muni booth. I will also caution those who choose to avail themselves of the valet parking at the hotel. While it was very convenient, I found that calling ahead for the car was not always successful. Most likely, the attendants were constantly out, moving the cars in and out, and were not there to answer the calls, so more often than not, I just had to head down and call for the car from the doorman and wait. Personally, I prefer Nob Hill as a central location for stays in SF, and in that sense, the Stanford Court certainly fit the bill. Other than my concern over the street noise, I would definitely recommend the Stanford Court and would stay there again on future trips to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Recovery from Napa wine tasting”
Reviews.Author: brownman6
Reviews.Content: Our two night stay on top floor of Stanford Court was a welcome respite from the hectic pace of two a day tastings in the Napa Valley. The restaurant and touring recommendations from the conincerge were excellent and the valet parking while expensive was well handled and worth it. We enjoyed the breakfast area, exercise room and conincerge loung in addition to our room with a view of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay at San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Deltaa
Reviews.Content: Ver y good hotel clean, good ,comfy beds,(one of the bests) Nice people I spend a bautiful stay

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyGrandpa
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed staying here. It is at the intersection of two cable cars. Great restaurant four blocks away, the Nob Hill.

Reviews.Title: “lovely old hotel”
Reviews.Author: lonestartravels
Reviews.Content: I picked the Stanford Court based on location and trip advisor reviews. I was very glad that I stayed here. It is an old hotel that has been updated. Housekeeping, reception, doormen and bartender were all very polite, friendly. It is very quiet. Our king room was a little small but not European small. Nice amenities, spotlessly clean rooms, quiet bar, comfortable beds, Aveda products. The only negatives are a $14.95 per day internet charge (other Marriott properties are usually free) and no gift/convenience store. Reception sells bus/cable car passes which are a great way to get around without needing exact fares. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hohja_md
Reviews.Content: We're East Coasters, so traveling to the West Coast is a big event. We were also traveling with 2 teenagers (13 and 14), so we needed to satisfy the teenage quotient as well. Our stay in San Francisco at the Stanford Court met all of my expectations. Our "California Adventure" started by landing in SF, picking up a car and proceeding to Yosemite, then heading to Monterey and finally ending in SF. We decided to spend 4 days in the city and I wanted a good central location to call "Home." I was initially concerned about location. I wanted to be in a good neighborhood, near to transportation and close to the things that I wanted to do. I was dropping off my rental car after we arrived as I did not want the expense of paying the extremely expensive rates to park a car. I looked at lots of Trip Advisors and settled in on the Stanford. This location is tough to beat. It sit on Top of Nob Hill, has a cable car stop for 2 different lines right in front of the hotel and if you are so inclined, is a close walk to China Town as well as Union Square (it's easier to catch the cable car though). Since we were traveling as a family of 4, we needed a room with 2 beds. I knew that the Stanford offered rooms with 2 queen beds, so I made this request on our reservation. I called a day prior to our arrival to ensure that we would have a 2 queen bed room. When we arrived, we were assigned an Inside room with 2 queen beds. My kids were uncertain if an inside room was for them, but after seeing the room, they were fine. Our inside room was quite spacious, had 2 windows which overlooked an inside courtyard, 2 large chairs, a desk and our room had a separate bathroom and sink area that was closed off with a door. In this same area, we had ample storage room for a couple of suitcases and all of our hanging clothes. This is an older hotel hat has been recently renovated with modern accommodations. This is not an old and worn hotel. The property has character and is well maintained. Basically, the Stanford fit us very well. Our room was very clean, which is a critical point, and we had no complains with any of the hotel services. Each hotel staff member that we encountered was pleasant and said hello. We even got to know a few on a first name basis. The Bell Staff was pleasant and helpful with directions. The Concierge Staff offered excellent choices for dinner. The Front Desk Staff was efficient and professional. Our 4 day stay in the city was enjoyable by all standards. A few personal recommendations regarding San Francisco: I see no need to drive a car in the city. I am glad that I did not have the worry of a car as driving the hills is an adventure and parking could be problematic. Looking down any of the hills in the city will immediately confirm that a car is not necessary. I would highly recommend purchasing a 3 day cable car/bus/trolley/subway (not Bart) pass from the front desk (I believe $18 for 3 days) - yes, the front desk sells these passes. The cable car stop is directly in front of the hotel, so it is extremely convenient. I believe that a single ride on the cable car is $6 as well, so this pass is a real bargain. Having the added bus and subway pass also helped in getting around the city. We started our first day in the city by taking a guided tour bus of the city. We picked up the tour in Union Square and the bus drives a loop through, and stops at, all of the well-known San Francisco landmarks - Fisherman's Wharf, Presido (Disney museum), Golden Gate Bridge, Golden Gate Park, Haight-Asbury, Painted Ladies, Financial District, etc. The Hotel Concierge made recommendations on which tour company to take (it was not a Gray Line Tour). Our tour served as a good introduction to the city and gave us an idea of what we wanted to see and of where we wanted to go. Union Square is several block down the hill and offers a wide array of upscale shopping and restaurant choices. There's a Starbucks on the corner between Union Square and the hotel that offers a good array of breakfast choices and drinks. There's also a CVS Drugstore right across the street from Starbucks to load up on any snacks too. This area was very active, and safe, into the early evening with lots of stores remaining open and people walking about. Chinatown is 2 blocks down the hill (in the other direction) and offers some fun cheap shopping and dining options (the Concierge was able to recommend an excellent Chinese restaurant). We felt completely safe in Chinatown even after dark as there are lots of people walking the streets. Fisherman's Wharf is no more than 10 minutes on the cable car down the hill. I am personally glad that I did not make the choice to stay down in the Fisherman's Wharf area - it's a great place to spend a couple of hours, but the vibe is the area is not as pleasant as in Nob Hill, or at the Stanford. While at Fisherman's Wharf, stop to see the sea lions on the pier as well as make time for some Boudin Sourdough at their Bread factory (go to their factory along Fisherman's Wharf and not just to a Boudin Bread Store). You can get a decent lunch there as well. Definitely take in the Alcatraz Tour and order your tickets as far in advance as you can from alcatrazcruises.com (they are the only vendor to and from the island, so there is no need to shop prices). I saw people being turned away at the dock who expected to walk up to purchase a ticket. Ghiradelli Square is close to FW, but not worth a special trip unless you have time to spend. The Ghiradelli Chocolate store is there and they provide a free sample of their chocolate, but overall, the store is quite small, crowded and expensive. It's also not a good place to try to catch a cable car as the lines are very long. if you have the time and are a sports fan, I would strongly recommend catching a Giant baseball game. We attended an afternoon game and AT&T Park is beautiful. I highly advise that you obtain tickets prior to getting to SF as good seats are difficult to come by and can be expensive. I arranged for tickets several weeks prior to our arrival and I was surprised on how difficult a good ticket, at any price, was to obtain. Overall, San Francisco is a wonderful touring city and The Stanford Court was an excellent hotel choice. The hotel receives my high marks for comfort and service. I think what's best about The Stanford Court is its location; this hotel a real hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, TOP of the hill”
Reviews.Author: t_rose72
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great rooms that are up to date. A little on the small side though as it also just fits a desk/chair and then a chair for lounging. Typical for SF though. Aveda products in the bathroom were nice. comfy beds and a flat screen tv. The trolleys run just outside which might be helpful if you need one. We did not face the street so can not say if you can bear from the rooms Front desk and concierge were nice and helpful. It is $14 for a shuttle to SFO, which they can set up for you. You pay $5 upfront and the rest to the driver. Pretty close to Union Square but it's at the top of a very steep hill! We had a drink in the bar and it was nice. We had more fun going to the Tonga Room across the street where they have tropical drinks and a rain show that goes off every 30min or so. Then the Top of the Mark is down the block too and has great views of the city. It was a short trip for us but we enjoyed the city and would stay here again definitely

Reviews.Title: “First time In San francisco”
Reviews.Author: weekend-explorers
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel in a really nice part of town. Our room was large and comfortable and very clean. The staff at reception were really friendly and efficient and check in was quick and easy. We thought the bar prices were a bit expensive and cannot comment on the restaurant as we ate out each night. Try the Cheesecake factory for quality or if you just want quick good food try Tads, both close by. Beware of parking charges! - the valet service was fast and friendly but it cost around $50 per day! Colin & Catherine Grainger

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: ashleighjustine
Reviews.Content: We used our Marriott points to stay here during out trip to San Francisco. We were immediately upgraded for free to a studio suite on the top floor without asking. The view was out of this world. You can see the bay bridge and beautiful skyline. We ordered room service for dinner and breakfast and everything was delicious! The hotel is right next to the fairmont hotel where the rooms cost 5x the amount but you still get the same great location and service for better value! There is a cable car stop right outside the hotel. Such a great and convenient location. The Decor was fresh and modern. The beds were super comfortable. Everything was top notch in my book. Aveda products are used here! Highly recommend this hotel. No negatives!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Tynante
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Stanford Court for 2 nights this past week. I booked the room through Priceline for $164/night, a very good price for a 4 star hotel in Nob Hill. Once we got there, we upgraded to a "suite," which wasn't really a suite but rather 2 adjoining rooms, one of which had a bed and the other of which was furnished as a living room (never checked to see if the couch pulled out into a bed). This cost us an additional $100/night. What we had not factored into our hotel costs was the parking fee of $58.14/night ($51/night plus $7.14 tax/night). Internet is also not thrown in as an amenity so that was an additional $14.95/night. Even that was spotty, kicking us off for quite a long time during a crucial telephone call. So all told, our 2 nights cost us right around $800 with all the taxes and fees. Slightly more than I was hoping to spend on a room. That being said, my husband and I enjoyed our time at the hotel. The room was nice, quiet, and spacious (with the extra living room area), but not "must stay in the room all day" nice. The location was superb with so many great locales (Chinatown, the Embarcadero area, and Union Square) within walking distance (though there is a significant uphill walk back to the hotel from nearly every direction). We had a good stay at the Stanford Court, but given the price and the total lack of amenities you could find at any chain hotel, we will look for another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great climb to a great hotel...worth it”
Reviews.Author: SidB
Reviews.Content: This great hotel is located a few blocks climb on Powell from the square. The entrance is magnificent with a "viranda". The check in process was amazing for me. Personalized. I had access to conciege lounge which had a variety of goodies. Best workout place. Please place ample disinfecting wipes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MoleDeMesa
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a good part of town. Centrally located at California and Powell. You are directly on two cable car lines if you want to get places, but keep in mind the cable cars, while practical, are expensive (6/ ride) to actually get around on due to their tourist popularity. This hotel is on the top of Nob Hill. So if you coming back to the hotel on foot you WILL go up hill. Leaving is down hill though! The hotel itself if very nice, but rather pricy. I paid for the "deluxe" room and found it very spacious and nice. For the $200/night rate you couldn't do much better considering the area. I did notice some of the smaller rooms (via peeking inside) and they looked very much smaller than my deluxe room. If the rates are similar you will be better off getting the deluxe room. Our room had a view from the 5th floor, but keep in mind that you WILL hear the cable cards when they go by during the day. The non-deluxe rooms may not have a view, but they are probably slightly quieter. With the fan on I could not hear any street noise. We also arrived before noon ( checkin is a 3 ) and they were able to get us a room! In all I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: lovetoeat818
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here with our kids aged 5 and 10. The hotel was very nice, room was a bit small, though high ceilings made it feel less so. Complimentary hot cocoa in the mornings was delicious. Service people were very nice, but I was a bit disappointed whenever I called the front desk staff, who seemed rushed and not particularly accommodating, especially after reading all the good service reviews. We parked 2 blocks away at Grace Cathedral ($25) b/c $50/day at the hotel is just too much and enjoyed a pleasant walk each evening when we got back. We walked downhill a few blocks to Chinatown for dim sum on the last day and regretted that we hadn't done this more often. Walking around the hilly, but quiet, neighborhood really wasn't that bad but we were blessed with great weather all week. Catching the cable cars or just seeing them go by right outside was fun.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: abbey1995
Reviews.Content: Located near to top of the hill on Powell St. Friendly welcome at reception, rooms next door to each other without having to ask, accommodation was of quality and excellent size. Daughter had a meal in the hotel and recommended it highly - didnt seem to need a reservation. Nice cocktails at the bar! You can even check your flight interactively on the wall board near the reception desk. Very nice hotel with concierge, bell boy and all your luggage and taxi needs taken care of. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location"”
Reviews.Author: Ramblingirl
Reviews.Content: I have never had faster room service in my life. Our breakfast arrived within 10 minutes of my ordering it. In addition, the location of this hotel, atop Nob Hill, is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation was jacked up - but the front desk fixed it”
Reviews.Author: Nexlex
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel an "excellent" rating because of the helpfulness of the front desk employees and the quality of the room. If I reviewed the reservation process only I would have given them a 1/2 star. I reserved three rooms in May for a family trip from 30 August - 1 September. The hotel is part of the Marriott brand but, according to the sign by the front desk, it is owned by someone else. I had called the hotel and the Marriott reservation number several times between May and August to ensure my reservation was in order ... and was told each time that it was. I arrived shortly before the stipulated check-in time and was told that due to late check-out by airline crews and a large number of guests that had already checked in I could not have the rooms or floor I had reserved. I am a Marriott elite member and always request a high floor away from noise, which is also noted in my profile. Instead of receiving my reserved rooms, I was offered three rooms on the lowest floor and instead of three king-bedded rooms, I was offfered one king room, one room with two queens, and one room with a single queen. My only other choice was to look for another hotel. I was able to negoitiate a lower price for the single-bedded room and received free WIFI in the king room. It wasn't much but better than nothing. The main reason I am giving the hotel the highest rating is that once I explained I am a light sleeper and that is why I request a high floor in a quiet area, the front desk employee was sympathetic and did everything possible to accommodate me.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, Not A Child or Priceline Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: Ron C
Reviews.Content: We booked a total of 12 different hotels for our trip down the west coast. Most of our hotels were booked on Priceline a month in advance and once the booking was made we phoned immediately to request a room with two beds since we were traveling with 2 older children. The Stanford Court was the only hotel that could not guarantee us a room with two beds even though we phoned to make the arrangements well in advance and we were staying 3 nights. They told us it would be on a best effort basis and as a fall back they could put a cot in the room. Sure enough, when we arrived at the hotel there were no rooms with double bed and the rooms they did have available were too small for 2 cots. We were left with no choice but to rent an additional room at the discounted rate of $99 or look for another hotel. Due to their policies and the inability to book a room with 2 beds this hotel should not be considered child or family friendly. I also got the sense they were not going to go out of their way to accommodate us because we booked on Priceline. The overall experience was very disappointing and costly for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, adequate rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelersUsFl
Reviews.Content: Great location on top of Nob Hill. Right outside the hotel is the intersection of the 2 main cable car routes. One route runs along California St and will bring you to the ferry building. The other runs along Powell St and will bring you to Union Square (lots of shopping and restaurants) or Fishermanâ€™s Wharf. We bought a 3 day Muni pass for $21 at the front desk and did not need a car. It cost ~$50/day to park your car so the pass was more cost effective and a fun way to get around. The service was very good. Check-in was quick and informative. The Concierge desk was very helpful but they were very busy at times. The rooms were older but good sized and well furnished. The TV was a large flat screen but located off to the left of the bed making it difficult to watch while lying in bed. The bed was a bit lumpy and pillows were on the thin side. However this was not a show stopper. We were comfortable and slept well. If you are looking for a great location and good service, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay; a few misses though”
Reviews.Author: ijfri
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy. Room was very nice and bed was comfortable. On our previous visit, we had an amazing view; this time we faced the internal courtyard. As a Platinum member of the Marriott program I would have expected a view again, but perhaps they were trying to give me a quieter room. No robes in the room; Shoe shine bag for overnight shoe shine not anywhere to be found, but mentioned in the directory. Lastly, we are locals and wanted to watch the Giants game for a while. It turns out they don't get that local channel in the rooms or in the bar. Too bad, we probably would have eaten in the hotel or had room service if they did.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: sfgfiat
Reviews.Content: The Stanford Court, with its motor court, exudes a contemporary San Francisco feeling. Atop Nob Hill, it provides views of the city that are lasting. The rooms are well furnished and have plenty of space. On our visit there were a number of business travelers so it must have that appeal. The advantage is being on Nob Hill which is literally above the city. The downside is the distance to other areas of the city. While the hills can obviously be walked, for some people cabs will be needed. The Powell Street street car line goes by the hotel. So, if your room faces Powell, expect to hear the clang clang early in the morning. But, all in all this is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: the_explorer7
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time at the Renaissance. The room had beautiful styling and was absolutely gorgeous. Not only was the room beautiful, the rest of the hotel was as well. This made our romantic trip that much more romantic. If you want to get away with your special someone, this is the perfect hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property in great location”
Reviews.Author: 2of7
Reviews.Content: The Stanford Court Renassaince is in a prime location on Nob Hill, San Francisco - at the intersection of two trolley lines. Right across from the famous Fairmount Hotel, without paying the price, or dealing with the stuffiness. Rooms are nice sized and have excellent bedding. The lobby bar / restaraunt has excellent service and very good food, although we dined at many of the fine restaraunts around town. The room prices were reasonable for the location and facilities. There is a very nice work out facility, but no pool or jacuzzi. Parking is expensive (over $50 / day), but that is the city, and the parking attendants are quick to serve up the car.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel-Great Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Milabella6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our an anniversary trip to San Francisco. It was just the two of us! We arrived 4 hours before check-in and were ready for an early lunch. The bellhops checked in our bags and issued a claim ticket and said our room would be ready right at 3 p.m. The staff didn't just suggest the great restaurant in the hotel but other little jems in the close vicinity of the hotel (Nob Hill Cafe-great Italian food but there is a wait for limited seating). The hotel staff was very friendly and truly helpful, we thought we were back in Texas! It started to rain hard before we headed out for lunch and we didn't have an umbrella. The hotel staff allowed us to use a Renaissance umbrella and told us where we could purchase a larger umbrella just a block away. We returned and we felt very welcomed to this hotel. Our room was very roomy and updated. Great city view and very private rooms. One night we ordered room service and the steaks we ordered were spectacular! Another night we were in the mood for pizza but did not want to leave our room. The staff gave us a couple of pizza numbers and let us know our pizza would be delivered to the lobby in just minutes. Milan pizza-Very convenient and delicious pizza! If you don't want to ask the staff for restaurant suggestions, the lobby has a very user-friendly menu board for food suggestions. The touch screen shows the distance from the hotel, the star rating and the average cost of each restaurant by food genre. It is fabulous. That is how we found a nice restaurant in Chinatown- The Oriental Pearl. For those of you that do not read Chinese, this food board assisted us in selecting this restaurant. When we walked through Chinatown earlier in the week, we were not sure which restaurants were mid$$$ or low$$$ becasue all of the information was in Chinese. In addition, a lot of restaurants in Chinatown do not have English menus, just pictures of the food and for me with pork allergies, I needed to know if I was going to eat chicken or pork. The restaurant staff let me know which meals were cooked away from the pork meals and assured me the chicken would be prepared separately. If we didn't look at the touch screen board, we would have missed out on the delicious lemon chicken and duck at the Oriental Pearl. My husband and I had a great time in San Fran and enjoyed our stay at the Renaissance!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern hotel- lots of pros, few cons”
Reviews.Author: FunTravelsfor2
Reviews.Content: My first impression of this hotel was that it was beautiful,clean, modern, new. The staff was very friendly. All things that I look for when booking a hotel. I will definitely stay there again. It is the perfect location for staying in San Fran. I learned a lesson however- and will have to keep this in mind on my next visit. When booking your room at this turely awesome hotel, don't request a city view. If you must have the city view, make sure it does not look down on California Street. The cable cars are on this side of the hotel, and while this is a fabulous tourist attraction- it is not as desireable when you are trying to sleep. We got very little sleep. The best bet would be to request a courtyard view. The courtyard is a nice feature at this hotel. When you arrive at the hotel, the vehicle can drive into the courtyard and you don't have to deal with your luggage street-side. This was a plus for me. We were suprised by the lack of quality of the towels in the room. For such a luxury room, the towels were comparable to that of a Holiday Inn. Like I said- lots of pros, very few cons. I hope this helps. Enjoy your stay. You wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again on our next visit”
Reviews.Author: vbtourist2004
Reviews.Content: This was a perfect location from which to explore San Francisco. The hotel staff was excellent and courteous and the rooms were very clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Quiet and Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: Patcarey
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned from four nights at the Stanford Court, and we have nothing but wonderful things to say about it, we loved it! First, Al is over 62 so we got a GREAT senior rate on the Renaissance Marriott website - we booked in early 2011. We wound up in room 160, which some people might not like as it is only one flight up, with absolutely no view at all (you look at a fence and flat roof area.) We also were right down the hall from the ice machine and the fitness center. No Worries - there was basically no noise at all for all four of our nights there, we loved that. The room was very big with two double beds, two lounge chairs, a desk and chair, a room safe and an open closet in the bath area, which we liked. The shower was fantastic, as were the heated towel bars. We had room service one evening as I did not feel too well, the soup and appetizer came in around 10 minutes. Also, we had an issue with the sound going out on the flat screen TV, the hotel engineer was there in minutes and swapped out the TV in minutes as well - something to be said for being on a low floor. It was a fabulous location, and if you need wine or beer just wander down to the little store at Powell and Pine, worth the walk. A fabulous trip and a stay at a hotel we loved!

Reviews.Title: “Always try to stay here when in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: K1962
Reviews.Content: The Standford Court is on Nob Hill across from the Fairmont and next to the Mark Hopkins Hotel. It's a perfect location! We particularly like staying here and request an inside room as there is less city street noise (sirens, cable cars, late night revelers, etc). The restaurant in the hotel is excellent, but it is also within walking distance of some of the best restaurants in San Francisco as well as Union Square. The hill is steep, but the good thing is that you can ride the cable car up Powell and get off right in front of the hotel! The rooms are large - a nice feature in San Francisco hotels - and are what you would expect for a luxury hotel of Marriott brand. Would definately stay here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “totally love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarah s
Reviews.Content: this was our second time at the stanford the location is excellent -right in the centre of all cable car lines with stops right outside there is a complimentary limo service for all guests weekdays between 7 and 3 to take you on short journeys the concierge staff were fab and booked stuff for us and suggested excellent retaurants which made our stay more pleasurable we asked to upgrade to a room with a view before we flew to the states and got exaclty the one one we wanted room service, bar staff, reception staff were so friendly and could not do enough for us it was the best hotel service we have received anywhere in the world

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with a Lovely Staff!”
Reviews.Author: vbravo83
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Stanford Court when my sister and my boyfriend were running the SF Marathon. We had a room with 1 queen bed. The bed was SO comfortable I loved it! I'm 7 months pregnant so it definitely helped to have a nice bed like that. The room was nice and service at the hotel was AWESOME!. Everyone was so helpful and worked hard to get us what we needed. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, great location hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtnspirit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for six weeks on business. The staff is helpful and the maid service is excellent. Request a robe and fridge for your room. Heated towel bars are nice and the location is on the cable car route at the top of California/Nob Hill. Stay on the 6th floor or higher to avoid the cable car noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good for work trips!”
Reviews.Author: Work_for_LIVE_events
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at Renaissance Hotels for my work related trips because I've never had a bad time and can completely focus on my work and meeting. This time it was as expected, everything was in order, the room was spotless, the meeting room I used was perfectly set when I arrived 30 minutes before I was supposed to start. Also, if you stay here do not leave without eating at Aurea Restaurant in the Hotel, the food is incredible. From now on this hotel will be my home for my San Francisco trips!

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel on Nob Hill but check what you book!”
Reviews.Author: MrT6561
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 2 weeks in CA and HA stayed at the Stanford Court SF for 4 nights. Hotel was good quality as expected, bit pricely but you pay for what you get. We had requested a room for 4 whilst booking (uk over the phone) They advised the hotel would able to provide- but at check in they sent us to room with just 3 beds and when we asked what we could about a 4th bed they actually said i could sleep on the floor as they could fit another foldeaway! (in a 4 star hotel at $280 a night!) Front of house did manage to sort some thing for us(cost more $ of course) But it was them doing what could to sort out what the booking process should have. I had tried to book direct with the hotel but was always passed on to a booking agent who clearly aren't aware of the on on site situation

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: Chicag0Jules
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the staff was fantastic -- very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and staff.”
Reviews.Author: cswenke
Reviews.Content: This hotel was at the top of Nob Hill, excellent area of San Francisco and right at the intersection of two cable car lines. Our family of 4 stayed in a corner room with a great view, plenty of room for all of us. Every staff member we encountered was wonderfully helpful. Shen, the concierge, helped us with great restaurant reservations suited for our mood each night. Herman helped us with our bags on arrival but then continued to give us helpful tips and a great smile each time we saw him for the rest of the weekend.
