The reservation agent at the front dest was most helpful as well, unfortunately we didn't get her name, but she assured me they would be able to find us a room suitable for 4, even though the website showed none available - and she came through for us. Food was also superb. The only drawback was the street noise at night. It didn't seem to effect our kids at all, it was pretty loud for mine and my husband's taste. Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel. Was worth the money. Good location for Union Square”
Reviews.Author: rc1987
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Very clean hotel with good facilities, including a gym, which altough isn't big, is perfect for keeping yourself fit whilst away. The staff were very helfpul and the location is perfect for restaurants and shopping. Only a â‚¬8 taxi ride from Fishermans Whalf. The only negative, is that it is at the top of a hill, which means a steep walk back from Union Square after dinner or shopping. We didn't find this a problem though as it only takes 5-10 minutes maximum and it keeps you fit.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....we alsways come back!”
Reviews.Author: Tman312
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in SF. Nob Hill location makes a great location for easy access to all areas of the city. Small but with an understated sophisticated feel. After visiting SF for over 35 years, it's still my favorite based on location, price and overall feel of the hotel. This isn't you're Father's Fairmont.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ufdiver27
Reviews.Content: The Stanford Court Renaissance was great! Our room was very clean and large and the bathroom was also large and stocked with Aveda bath products. The hotel is at the intersection of 2 cable car lines which made getting around the city very easy. The hotel parking is expensive, about $50 a night so we went down the street to Leavenworth (State Street garage, I think), and paid about $15 a day to park the car in their small garage. It's a manageable walk to the hotel, about 10 minutes, but it is uphill part of the way.

Reviews.Title: “Great first experience in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: magestic14
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my fiance for a weekend during a friends wedding in June. It was my first time in San Francisco and the hotel was convienently located to all the main attractions, or a short cable car ride away. The room was nice, extremely comfortable bed. We ate in the hotel cafe before we went exploring, got the fruit plate (enough to feed 3 people!) and their famous souffle pancakes, they will give you the recipe if you ask. If you like pancakes, this is a must, they were incredible. We didnt spend much time in the room because of wedding activites, but thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and would go back if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location and staff but noisy”
Reviews.Author: msbout
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as we were in town for a wedding and also wanted to make it a nice getaway. The hotel is perfectly located on Nob Hill across from the Fairmont ( which we love and have stayed at many times). You can get the same great location for half the price at the Stanford Court. Our reservation was for a standard room which they note in their reservations as either 1 king, 1 queen or 2 doubles. NOTE: Just arrive at the hotel as early as possible to get the room you want. The staff try very hard to get you the best view,and the room that you want but really, there are a limited number of King rooms for example. I would like to personally thank staff member Oscar for being very attentive, accomodating and trying so hard to get us the room we wanted. We ended up on the highest floor but one with a Queen bed. The room was comfortable and clean. I loved having the full length mirror in the bathroom. The high ceilings also make up for the typical small square footage that is SF. My only complaint is that the room whihc was facing the Mark Hopkins hotel was very noisy. All hours of the night there was noise from trash collection, cable cars all the way until 12:30am, bell noises from everywhere and in general the windows arent great. We were on the 8th floor ( top floor) so you can imagine if you are on a lower floor? We tried to ignore it as we were so buy exploring the city. Also, it looks like a lot of the pilots and flight crew stay at this hotel therefore, its pretty crowded all the time. Again, cant say enough about the wonderful staff and clean accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: 1mommax3
Reviews.Content: We had a spacious room with a beautiful view of the city. We were right on the trolley line and close to a coffee shop. We were sad to leave this hotel! We will definitely consider a stay here in the future. We had one meal in the restaurant. Delicious, but overpriced, as expected in a hotel restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NY21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Stanford from July 8-11th. The hotel is in a wonderful location with access to all the cable cars and short cab rides away from important San Fran destinations. Hotel was spotless, and the staff was courteous, especially the doormen. Their service was exceptional. We are Marriott rewards members and the only disappointment was the club lounge was closed for the weekend. It opened on Sunday evening. However for the inconvenience we were upgraded to a larger corner room with a lovely view of the city. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a Good Price”
Reviews.Author: sh0rtypie
Reviews.Content: It's hard to find a good hotel in San Francisco at a decent price. I think I got this hotel for around $130 a night, which is a good price and the hotel was good. The staff are very nice, the rooms are clean. The location is great. It was very easy to get cabs everywhere. The walk to public transportation is a bit long, but when I'm on vacation, I tend to use cabs anyway so this didn't really bother me. As a bonus, the hotel also saved my life by offering same day dry cleaning service which I needed in an emergency. This accidentally got charged twice to the room, but as soon as I pointed it out to the front desk, they promptly fixed the problem so no harm done there - just good thing I checked the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great views, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: c4trader
Reviews.Content: I love the central location of this hotel perched high atop Nob Hill. Be sure to request an outside room because the views are amazing. The inside rooms look down upon a dreary courtyard, which would make the stay much less pleasant. The rooms are very spaceous and the staff is extremely helpful and professional. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ashulton
Reviews.Content: This hotel was brilliant. We stayed there as part of our honeymoon and got a free upgrade which was greatly appreciated as we had been travelling around the world of 6 weeks and wanted to treat ourselves. The staff were very friendly and helpful and always keen to asist with anything. The room was fairly small, but it had a great view of San Francisco, although it could be quite noisy at times with the cable car route running up and down the hill until the early hours. We were warned of this before we were given this room. (We were originally offered an internal courtyard room, but we wanted a view). The bathroom was really clean and even had a heated towel rail! As someone with long hair I really appreciated having more than 1 full size towel each. Breakfast wasn't included, one day we ate in and it was fairly expensive. If you are prepared to walk about 10 minutes and want an authentic American diner then go to Pinecrest Diner on Mason and Geary. If you have a car (you don't need one in SF) it is very expensive to park (valet parking is $50 pn). The other criticisms I have is that in the room there was only one tea bag and there was no English Breakfast tea and the way the hotel is laid out means that if you have a room on the opposite side from the lifts it is quite a walk which is difficult with a lot of luggage. They have free wifi in the lobby and will also print out your boarding pass for free which is a great service. Tip: you can buy a 3 day Muni (public transport pass) from reception.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it but...”
Reviews.Author: love_sf42
Reviews.Content: First time to stay at this hotel. The front desk and housekeeping were excellent. The room was clean and pleasant. However, the room that we stayed at #263 was on top of the fitness center. Early every morning at 6 am we were awakened by the noise of the treadmills and the noise of running water. The view was less than desirable since we can only looked at the rooftop of old bldg. Mattress and pillows need improvement, they were very uncomfortable. One plus side in staying at this hotel, you do get free workout by climbing up and down on the hills.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here”
Reviews.Author: mewosery
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay. Had connecting rooms, the view wasn't great -Had to wait for our rooms to turnover, as we arrived at 12, the rooms weren't avail close to 4PM. -Rooms were a bit small (double bed rooms were slightly larger), bathroom had the sink outside the actual bathroom, we didn't get a good view, had the back of the hotel. -Housekeeping was efficient and friendly. -Club Lounge was terrific, staff was efficient, breakfast was abundant, though wished they extended the time beyond 9AM. Great views from the lounge as well. Front Desk--efficient and knowledgeable, knew most/if not all the guest names, when they passed by. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: JRCan
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for our stay ( aprox 10.00am) they were very accomodating and found us a room.The room was great,clean, well appointed and comfortable. There was no noise from any neighbouring rooms, with minor noise coming in from outside.( trolley car) Everyone ( staff) we encountered at the hotel were polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: McBerr
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. It was lovely!! Although the room was a little small for standard hotel rooms, but consider it is a fairly old building, that's almost understandable. The service was impeccable, staffs were friendly, very helpful. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel... On the top of a hill. Street cars can be loud if your window is looking out over the street.”
Reviews.Author: Citygir
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Would stay here again but you will have to walk up (and down) a good size hill if you stay here. In union square/nob hill. Close walking distance (less that 1 mile) to some very good restaurants. Next time I'll ask for a room away from the the main street. Do not eat at the hotel resturant. Bad food.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - slept well”
Reviews.Author: eyelanddoc
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and used points to reserve the room. Convenient location near Union Square and along the cable car route. Friendly and pleasant valet and front desk help. Stayed in room 340 - no view, modern room, large TV, no fridge (minibar fridge only), no free wifi, enjoyed the bed (slept well). Parking is expensive at the hotel $52 (with in/out privileges). The front desk staff advised the parking garage below the Grace Cathedral ($27/24hr & no in/out privileges) - easy walk 2 blocks north. Not sure I'd pay the going rate for this hotel, but with points, I enjoyed my stay, and I'm sure you would, too.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheJoinersUK
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the 17th June for three days and have to say the hotel is lovely. Helpful staff, great location. Didnt eat at the hotel but everyone we spoke to went on and on about the lemon pancakes, so maybe next time. Cable car right outside to take you to Fishermans or the main shopping centre. One little niggle. Ask for a room as high above the gym as you can get. We were on the second floor and the running machines started every morning we were there at 6am. Overall Fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fabulous Views, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: dld8
Reviews.Content: Visited friends over Memorial Day and had a wonderful time - the Stanford Court was one of the contributing factors! Loved the location - Nob Hill is such a great area - great exercise every day walking up and down the hills of SF. Was on the Concierge Floor looking out onto the Bay. Cable Cars were right below and while I could hear them dinging all day long - was a nice happy sound (if noise bothers you suggest an inner view room - no view then ). Room is small but elegantly furnished - love having access to the concierge lounge: Free breakfast, juice, water, drinks all day long. Happy Hour buffet if you are around. The staff was great! Had 2 meals in the restaurant downstairs and have to say the food was quite good! The staff was very friendly and the restaurant manager made sure to say good bye - hope to see you again. If you are there on a Saturday - make a trip to the Ferry Building for the Farmer's Market. Was really so fun and interesting. The fruit, vegetables, food was so fresh - was the real deal - brought back a bunch of snacks for the room. Will definitely be back to the Stanford Court for next trips to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: mgrindell
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stanford Court for a trip with my 16 year old daughter. Service was excellent, the location is ideal - Nob Hill, Union Square, Chinatown, cable cars all very close. The hotel was the perfect place to enjoy SF.

Reviews.Title: “NOT WORTH THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: Devonshire123
Reviews.Content: Chose the hotel for location on Nob Hill and the Marriott Renaissance reputation. Asked for a quiet premium room on high floor. Room was extremely small, noisy noisy noisy and over packed with furniture. Towels were ready for the donation bin. Dirty carpets throughout the halls. Would recommend the Mark Hopkins if you want Nob Hill.

Reviews.Title: “Super Concierge, Elegant and Comfortable Public Areas”
Reviews.Author: Lizedben
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen by the company sponsoring the meeting my husband attended, so we enjoyed both a business and a leisure experience here. Pros: Fabulous concierge service, super location on Nob Hill at the intersection of the cable car lines (though one line is currently down for renovation), beautiful lobby/lounge area with crisp and comfortable decor, excellent wait staff in the restaurant. Cons: It's an old building, so the room was smallish, though furniture was comfortable and up to date. $15/day for internet. Only ice machine was on 1st floor, and we were on the 5th floor, about a football field away from the elevator. Neither pro nor con: Our interior room overlooked the courtyard roof -- boring but at least no loud street noise. We were able to crank the window open a bit to get some cool fresh air.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: R60lam
Reviews.Content: The hotel was full when we were there- due to a number of conventions in the city. That said the service was excellent and nothing was too much trouble. Ric the concierge was particularly helpful booking us a Mustang convertible and sorting out all the paperwork while we carried on with our holiday. Breakfast was something else with the best French toast I've ever tasted - my wife had the lemon souffle pancakes which were equally nice. Breakfast was expensive and the empty restaurant suggested that most guests found it too expensive so the hotel might want to think about that - try it once though - we did and it was lovely although over $60 for breakfast is a bit steep. $15 a day for wi- fi - when will these hotels learn - walk down to Starbucks - it's free. Overall I would recommend this hotel but would have got an extra star if they could learn how to set a fair price for food - we would have eaten there every day if it had been priced more reasonably.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: pflores72001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our wedding weekend, and were thrilled with the service, the rooms and the location. We were upgraded to a corner top floor suite upon sharing that we were getting married, and really had a great time at the hotel. Suite was wonderful, with spectacular views, the lounge is a cool area for late night hanging out (post wedding) and we can't say enough about the friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable night in a great location”
Reviews.Author: davidandrose1
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable and comfortable night's sleep. Evening flight and a late dinner had us spend a night in SF before driving up to Napa for a few days and really liked the hotel. As Marriott Gold, was upgraded on arrival to an 8th floor room with a very nice view of the bay and city landmarks. Room is an odd shape due to the old-world architecture of the hotel, and we found that a plus as well. Room was in good shape, newer technology throughout, great nights sleep for us both. Nob Hill location is excellent, several parking lots within 2 blocks if you want to skimp a bit on the hotel's valet charge. Have stayed in many SF hotels and would definately return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Stay in SF”
Reviews.Author: GiLaurant
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three wonderful nights. Normally would pick a standard Marriott out of habit but lately have been enjoying the Renaissance properties for their unique and charming qualities. This hotel has real old world charm. High ceilings, plush beds, old fashioned (probably H2O inefficient) bathrooms with a lot of marble. Also had breakfast every morning in the lounge. Outstanding every day. They take coffee quite seriously here. Expected watered down and bland coffee like at the Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons but this was real deep and richly roasted coffee, made strong but not brutally so. The waiter was proud to point out that they used a smooth South American blend that was full bodied and delicious. Every morning my girlfriend ate Lemon Souffle pancakes. Our friend got stuck on the croissant egg bacon sandwich and I ended up eating a little of everything, the last morning devouring one of my girlfriend's sweet and airy pancakes. Yum. Place was great. Location was convenient for shopping and exploring and also, it's just a beautifully romantic SF spot. We all had a blast. Make sure you go for a little night-time swinging in the park in front of Grace Cathedral. We all behaved like school kids the last night and it was silly, fun and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Good location! What you would expect in a Renaissance”
Reviews.Author: Euro_101
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel in a good location. Right on the cable car line and a few blocks from union square. I chose the Reanaissance because I have stayed at them before, so I knew what to expect. I expected a certain amount of cleanliness and 'plushiness' by staying here. My expectations were met and I would stay here again. Note that valet parking was about $50 per day. At first I thought this was ridiculous, but it's not unique to this hotel, all places I looked at charged similar amounts for parking. The nice thing is that you can go in/out as many times as you want.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in SF!”
Reviews.Author: jjjf2510
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Stanford Court many times and have always had a wonderful experience. For a city hotel the price is always very reasonable and the location is excellent. A quick walk to Union Square and an easy walk to North Beach, Ferry Building etc... The only problem is that the queen bed rooms are actually double beds. I mentioned this to the hotel staff and they said they are queens but they are much smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Management”
Reviews.Author: garydw33
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at this hotel for business. My room had a defective smoke alarm that kept going off on my second day. The engineering department came up and looked at it and had the front desk reset the system. A few minutes later it went off again, and the engineering department repeated the process. While I was out at a breakfast meeting the alarm went off again. As I entered the room, two engineers were replacing the alarm. As I was checking out I was informed that there was a $250 charge for smoking in the room. When I explained that I do not smoke and that the engineering department had told me it was a defective alarm, the manager came over. I again explained the situation and was informed that since the smoke alarm had gone off, that I was smoking in the room. Again, I explained that I do not smoke and that I was told it was a defective alarm. The manager then told me that he would temporarily remove the charge and investigate the room and that WHEN he found evidence and residue that he would reapply the charge. At no time did this manager apologize for any inconvenience or problems the faulty alarm may have caused. It has now been a week since my visit and I have not heard from the hotel, so I know they did not find any evidence or residue. I have still not received an apology for accusing me of a violation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Giuseppe68Napoli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a mile or maybe less from Union Square. However, the area is nice, with restaurants and spa. I was impressed from the concierge, the service was great, always someone available to give informations, directions, with maps and addresses. Also, they have parking. The rooms are clean and comfortable. But do not chose the side on the tram road...it is not quite. I had a cocktail at bar, probably the best Manhattan I ever had. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, breakfast under expectations”
Reviews.Author: LuisMurano
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, very well located. Beds and bathroom are perfect and rooms are overall very quiet, which is great for sleep quality. My only complaint is related to the breakfast offered. Food is good but the portions are so small and expensive that doesn't look at all with an American Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay, wonderful staff, central location”
Reviews.Author: BrewTravels
Reviews.Content: If you like to walk and explore, this hotel is a great home base. Located at the top of Nob Hill, we were centrally located to walk (or take the cable cars) to many locations and attractions. Staff were very kind and helpful without being too formal. We would stay here again next time we visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonPenguin1
Reviews.Content: Stanford Court is a nice, typical 4* city hotel. Great location, downtown is only a few minutes walk away although if you don't like walking down steep hills, you can easily jump on a cable car as it stops right by the hotel. We got assigned a room with a view but changed to an inside room due to noisy roadworks taking place outside along with the clanging of the cable cars. We did ask when we checked in if the room was noisy as we'd prefer a quieter room. We were assured that it was only a little bit noisy but the view was great. In fact, the room was very noisy and the view was only ok. However, when we asked to change rooms, this was done with no fuss or problem which was much appreciated. The rooms were nicely decorated and extremely clean. Housekeeping were very helpful - had no problem getting extra towels when we asked and when we left the "do not disturb" sign on the door by mistake, they made up the room for us in minutes at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence”
Reviews.Author: EYeo
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in May 2011. Well Located on Nob Hill, at the junction of two cable car lines. Room had no view, but was very comfortable. Beds were incredibly comfy... great comforter on a firm mattress. Free wifi in lobby. Reading lamps a bit dim (they were fancy LED types). Efficient check-in and check-out. Friendly service. It can be tricky to take the cable-car up the hill to the hotel during popular hours though... we had to hike back to the hotel more than once cos the cable-cars were packed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service and Location - Great Price, LOVED IT!!”
Reviews.Author: saay555
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel that had staff that was more helpful or nice. The decor was awesome. Location and beds are GREAT. Easy everything! The only complaint I have is the noise. Thin walls. Also we stayed by the elevator so it was a little noisy late at night. The awesome beds made up for it. The staff was very helpful with things to do. I will stay here every time I visit San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: Flycasterwa
Reviews.Content: Checked in 3/2 at 6:30 PM, room was roomy for SF hotels at this price. Resonably furnished and comforable. Bed was average, not the glowing review others had posted. The room faced an ally and a brick wall. Lots of activity in building next door and alley so very noisy and dark. I asked for a different room and was refused. DId not seem very customer service oriented (front desk) and I am a marriott rewards client. Valet parking very expensive, not unusual for SF hotels again. Asked concierge to make dinner reservations and never heard back from them, left cell and room number. Valet and front door people seemed to be the only ones happy to see me. spent most of my time at the fairmont accross the street where they seem to appreciate customers. VERY Dissapointed, I hope my experience was isolated. Will do a follow up review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ted4364
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in mid February, and it was wonderful. The hotel is clean and very well appointed. The front desk staff was most accomodating when we requested a room change. The rooms are spotless, spacious, and quiet if you have an inside room. The weather was cold and rainy while we were there, so we ate many meals at the hotel, and the food was very good at breakfast, dinner, and room service. However the dining room was short staffed, and service was slow, but everyone that was working was doing their best and had great positive attitudes. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Worldworn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights whilst on the West Coast for a conference in Santa Barbara. I flew into SFO, stayed for 2 nights, before electing to drive down Highway 1 to Santa Barbara for the conference. I should stress that I stay in many 4* and 5* hotels for business all the time, so am able to compare and contrast a lot of hotels of this calibre. I landed at about midday, picked up the hire car and drove to the hotel. I probably arrived about 2.30pm or so. Overall I had now been travelling for about 24 hours (I live in Singapore). The valet parking was straightforward and pleasant enough. However at the check in, I was informed no rooms were available, and would only be available at 3pm. I gave my mobile number and they said they would call the moment teh room became available. I stepped into the bar for a beer. By 3pm, no phone call, so I went to the desk again to finally get my room. Still no room was available (so fair enough on the non-existent phone call I guess), so went for another beer and went back to the desk at 3.30pm as there still hadnt been a call. This time there was a room. Great - but why no phone call to tell me? The room was a disabled-friendly room (not disclosed to me at the front desk) at the end of a long corridor. This was not a big issue as disabled-friendly rooms are generally more spacious. The bed was very comfortable, the room very clean, the TV had a great selection of channels and the bathroom was pretty large as well. All as expected I would have said. However, the big problem came when having to use the bathroom. As I stated the bathroom was very spacious (presumably so a wheelchair would be able to move around in it). The sink and lavatory were fine - but the shower had some big problems in my view. This is a bit hard to decribe so bear with me. The shower head was fixed in a position in the corner of the stall, and I just couldn't move the direction it was pointing in at all. I could adjust the height ok, but not the direction. The problem was it was pointing directly down onto a foldable seat that the stall had (again presumably for a wheelchair user to use when washing). Not being disabled however, I just couldn't get into a position between the foldable seat and the unmovable direction of the showerhead where the weater actually landed on me in an effective manner. This wasnt helped by the fact that the water pressure was terrible, which meant that the stream of water simply didn't direct outwards in any way at all. Don't get me wrong here, I think its great to have disabled-friendly rooms in hotels. I truly do. However if you are going to double them up for use by able-bodied individuals, then you need to make sure the able-bodied individual can actually use the room in a standard manner. Essentially, it was so poor, that I had no choice but to take the shower head off and hold it above my head. That might be ok in a 2* room at $50 a night - but not in a hotel of this quality and price. The hotel is excellently situated and the service (other than that irritating check in process) was actually pretty good. I also didn't experience any of the traffic noise that others mention, but then my view was of a brick wall opposite the hotel, so I assume I was at the back. The real problem with this place is that nothing in particular was special, and the shower was truly awful, which really did detract from my enjoyment of what should have been a great stay. I am going to recommend this hotel I guess, but I would insist at check in or reservation time that you do not stay in a disabled-friendly room, unless of course, you are disabled. Hope the above is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Views from high floors are amazing and beds are to die for!”
Reviews.Author: George30_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel as did some of our family. We'd come to San Fran from the UK to get married at City Hall and are so glad we chose this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the concierge desk could not do enough to help. We were upgraded when they found out we were getting married and our room was amazing. We had the most brilliant view and the bed was the best we have ever slept in! The room was very clean and we could not have asked for more. The hotel is in a prime location, the cable car stop is right outside and takes you straight into Union Square (which is few blocks to the right and can be walked as its all downhill) or into Fisherman's Wharf. It is also very near to Chinatown. We would definitely use this hotel again in the future not only because it holds so many happy memories of our wedding but because we genuinely think its lovely and has everything we think a good hotel should have!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quiet hotel with fantastic beds”
Reviews.Author: LaraMark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Renaissance Stanford Court between Christmas and New Year, originally we were only going to stay one night but the hotel was in such a good location, the beds amazingly comfortable and so quiet (no traffic noise!) that we decided to stay longer. The hotel rate is also pretty reasonable given that it's well appointed and such a nice standard. This hotel is located opposite the Fairmount Hotel, which is nice to pop into for cocktails. Also close by is the Top of the Mark (in the InterContinental Hotel Mark Hopkins), you can pop in here and whizz up in the elevator to the bar on the top floor for drinks and fabulous views out across the city. The Stanford Court is also just round the corner from the cable car stop so that's easy to jump on and off to either go to Fisherman's Wharf or Union Square. All in all a great base for a few days in the City (we then headed up to the Winelands). We didn't eat at the hotel but food in the surrounding area (just a few blocks walk was very good).

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: fredbon
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable service! Our bar and dining waitress, Donna, was so wonderful, we looked forward to having her serve us. Ric and Shannon, our concierges, went out of their way to arrange tours, help us in so many ways. Every employee of the hotel that we encountered was so helpful and friendly. The beds were great- what more can I say- choose the Stanford Court. The hills are crazy, but this is San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great San Francisco Feeling”
Reviews.Author: richard0223
Reviews.Content: This newly renovated hotel is a great place to stay. Staff is very freindly and helpful, has new rooms and lobby...the gift shop was not yet open yet, though.....the hotel sits about halfway up Nob Hill, so if you don't mind walking up and down hills, it is very close to downtown. If you can't manage the steep hills, a cab is just $5, or you can use the house limo for a ride. The pillows were very hard foam, so I asked housekeeping to bring up some feather pillows, which they did promptly. The bar and lounge is very comfortable and a nice place to relax and have a drink and read or wait for a friend. Parking in SF hotels is quite expensive...I recommend looking on the internet for discount parking, about $20 per night and a 12 minute walk. The St. Mary's garage on California Street two blocks down the hill is just $7 per night on week-ends, $32 week-days but no in/out. Overall, I like this hotel and is one of my San Francisco favorites. If your room is on the street, expect the sounds of The City (which I like), but the views are great. For a quieter night, request and inside room, but no view.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Stanford Court”
Reviews.Author: Chapsbaby
Reviews.Content: The Renaissance Stanford Court is absolutely as awesome as all the reviews say it is. Stayed here for a week with family and loved everything about it. First of all, great location on Nob Hill. The cable car stops are right outside the hotel door. The room rate during our stay was excellent. Had a nice large double bed room with a nice view. Bathroom was very roomy. Spouse is a large Marriott rewards point holder, so we had access to lounge - which is very nice. All of the staff that we met while there was wonderful - very customer oriented. Again, since spouse has Marriott points - was eligible for free internet which worked well. If going to San Fran - would highly recommend the Stanford Court - I hope to be able to head back there sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and impeccable accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: Mimi6567
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and the staff is incredibly accommodating and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, staff, and restaurant...embodiment of perfection.”
Reviews.Author: DeterminedExplorer
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a vacation to San Francisco and decided to stay at the Stanford Court Renaissance. My husband is a devotee of the Marriott brand and he said "I just know this is going to be great." Boy was he right! Service was impeccable for our entire five night stay, from the bellman to the front desk and housekeeping. And the restaurant was divine! I ordered the apple pie four times during our stay! The restaurant has the freshest and most wonderful ingredients. Normally I don't care for hotel restaurants, but you must try this one! We frequently asked staff members for personal recommendations about places to go and they never let us down. Everyone was ready to help with directions or anything we needed. We had a fantastic view from our room. The beds were incredibly comfortable (typical of the Marriott brand) and the room was wonderfully clean. I just can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. Excellent location too! You can catch the cable cars right outside the hotel! If you are visiting San Francisco, you must consider this hotel. They won't let you down!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view from Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: mrcanfield3
Reviews.Content: As it sits a top of Nob Hill. You have an amazing view to any area near the wharf and you are centralized in the middle of San Fran to go to Chinatown, little italy, and all the tourist and traditional places in San Fran. It is very clean with a great restaurant and room service. We enjoyed our stay here very much!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, would have liked a little bit bigger room.”
Reviews.Author: Kfizzo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. Tram stop just outfront of the hotel, we decided to walk down the bottom of the hill which did not take to long, but the same cannot be said for the way up, but it was still great. The bed and pillows were comfortable, the room was very clean. The only negative would be the size of the room was quite small. The location is really great aswell, but we did have a car for a day which made it handy to travel around. Unfortunately there was no free parking, but this was fine. Also, the staff were very friendly and helpful and knew where all tourist attractions were. We loved that the hotel had town cars available to guests (if they were not already being used), and therefore you only had to pay a tip. This was a great bonus to this hotel. Breakfast was also beautiful, and had a great variety, and wait staff were fantastic. Would definately recommend this hotel, but just be prepared for aa bit of a smaller room.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location if you don't mind the hill”
Reviews.Author: GoingGlobal2010
Reviews.Content: I got a great discount rate through the Marriott website and decided to check out this Nob Hill hotel for a long weekend. The staff was great and the property seemed fully staffed (unusual these days). Located on the corner of California and Powell streets, it was a straight walk to the heart of Union Square. Keep in mind that about three of these blocks are up and down the very steep hill, but you can grab a cable car right to the corner of the hotel if not up for the climb. We were updated to a room with a view which was nice. All of the staff was friendly, helpful and responsive. Further up California were the Intercontinental and the Fairmont, both of which have an older feel in contrast to the contemporary decor of the Stanford. Went to Top of the Mark in the Intercontinental for a drink and to check out the view, the view is indeed great but the experience is disappointing, very rushed feeling even at 3pm. Anyway very much enjoyed the Stanford.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: OnestoMaschio
Reviews.Content: First, the location is excellent. You are right in the middle of it, a short trolley to financial district/embarcadero. A short walk to Chinatown. Beware of bringing your own car $45/night for parking. Internet/Wi-Fi is $14.99/day. Mark Hopkins is $15.99/day if you choose that route. Service throughout our stay was pretty lacking. Upon arrival the bell man did not seem to know what we were there for. I told him that we were checking on and then would come back for the luggage. I got the blank stare. At check in, another blank stare guy. He gave us ZERO information about the hotel/ammenities. It was like I was checking into a motel for one night and given a key with a big plastic placard with the number 4 on it. I then return to the car for the luggage and told the bellman that help with the luggage would be appreciated. I guess I should have tipped him first because I had to load the cart and then tell him what room I wanted them to go. First day on the job? The Aurea restaurant was pretty good we ate breakfast and dinner there. Again the staff here were pretty worthless, but the food was pretty good. For breakfast they kept trying to upsale. My wife took a sip of my OJ and the waiter immediately came over to offer her a glass. I almost expected an extra charge for her taking a sip. I guess management is to blame for the lack of customer service. I would have thought that these guys would be happy to have a job with the current state. We had spent the 3 days prior in Las Vegas and EVERYONE there was happy to see us. Overall, the experience could have been much more than it was. The only thing lacking is the staff and if you can get past that it is a hotel with plenty of good qualities. If you get a good deal for this hotel I would say to give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Your Stay In San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ccmacy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful surprise on Nob Hill. Right next door to the Mark Hopkins and across the street from the Fairmont, this is a hidden gem. Very clean, Updated recently, amazingly comfortable beds, great restaurant. But what sets it apart from the rest is the amazing service. Every single employee I encountered was sincerely friendly and eager to help. They go out of their way to make your stay the best it can be, all with a genuine smile on their faces. We will definitely return and have another conference here. The people make this the #1 Hotel in my book! Excellent in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely updated and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: new_england_expat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two consecutive weekends (with a stint in Napa in between) and found the hotel to be clean, comfortable, and well-located. The area is more residential than commercial (unlike the area where most of the big hotels are), but it's a short walk to Union Square, Chinatown, and North Beach, and the Fairmont and one of the Intercontinental properties are on the same block. Public transportation is close: a BART station within blocks and cable car right out front. Nothing glamorous about the rooms, but they are roomy, modern, and comfortable, with Aveda toiletries supplied. Extra pillows arrived within minutes of calling. Big negative was the $15 fee for in-room wireless, but there is free wireless in the lobby. Also, the concerns about cable car noise are legit, but the front desk was very accommodating in placing us in interior rooms both weekends, and I never heard the bells at all in either room. Especially if you have Marriott Rewards, this property is a good value for the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great property! Surprisingly good rates for location and amenities.”
Reviews.Author: dab123
Reviews.Content: We spent one night in San Francisco after a stay in Monterey. After reading a ton of reviews, we decided to stay at the Renaissance Stanford Court. What a great way to end our vacation! The location is fantastic, the property is beautiful, the bed was sooooooo comfy and the staff is very friendly. The room was a little small, but beautifully updated and we had no plan to be in the room that much anyway. We will definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone - business or leisure! If you don't have to, don't bring a car - parking is expensive and you won't use a car anyway. We took the BART from the airport to Embarcadero station ($16.20 each round trip) and took a cab for $8 (including tip) to the top of the hill. Enjoy San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!”
Reviews.Author: laislapr
Reviews.Content: We were here two nights at the concierge level and it was wonderful The beds were amazing, the room and bathroom are spacious The club has free use of computer and printer, big screen TV's, honor bar, free breakfasts and appetizers in the afternoons The location and views are fantastic Service is incredible We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Top of Nob Hill and on top of list as far as service!”
Reviews.Author: raphbacry
Reviews.Content: My colleagues and I stay several times a year (3 to 4 days at a time) in this hotel, and we all agree that the service in impeccable. It is the most friendly and efficient staff I have ever worked with. We hold conferences in one of the nice rooms and more than once, the manager came to check on us and spent time with us just making sure we add a pleasant stay in addition to having all our business needs fulfilled. Plus the location is just ideal: you can walk or take the trolley to the Wharf or to Union Square, Chinatown is a few blocks down etc. Although I go there for work, the stay is so nice that it makes it look like a mini vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, just up the hill from Union Square.”
Reviews.Author: Watermark00
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Renaissance Stanford Court, almost weekly for 4 months. In June, I flew my wife in for the weekend and used this hotel as our launch point for exploring SF and Marin County. Great times. This hotel is on a historic site and just up the hill (albeit a steep, steep hill) from Union Square's shops, restaurants and nearby theatres. Highly recommended. If you don't want to walk the hill, all three Cable Car lines pass by this hotel. Great choice for an extended travel or a quick weekend trip.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: parentsoflawstudent
Reviews.Content: Very courteous staff and the rooms were very clean. Loved the down comforter and pillows--made for an excellent night of sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Grand, elegant hotel. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: FightOn
Reviews.Content: I love San Franciso and love the Stanford Court. Located at the peak of Nob Hill it is a great jumping off point to explore many of the different neighborhood of San Francisco. It is especially close to Chinatown and Union Square. As for the hotel itself, its elegant in every regard. From the porte cochere, to the lobby and the restaurant. The service is excellent to match. I received great dining suggestions from the concierge. As an elite Marriott member, I appreciate a hotel with a good club lounge and this did not disappoint. On the sixth floor, with panoramic views and food throughout the day, it was a nice place to relax. I did ask for a quiet room at check-in and was given one with an interiot courtyard view. I guess it was quieter than the street, but there were some loud guests down in the courtyard, Now the bed, spectacular. This is the new marriott bed and it is a better night sleep than I get at home. The rooms look to all have been renovated recently and are very comfortable. This is a hotel that works equally well for business or pleasure. And with an excellent rate, it can be a great value. Just don't bring a car to San Fran, its not needed and parking is ridiculously expensive. Walk, ride the cable cars or use a cab.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location, Comfy Beds & Outstanding Service=A Great Trip!”
Reviews.Author: romadaro
Reviews.Content: What else can I say? This hotel is uniquely positioned between Fisherman's Wharf and Union Square with a Cable car stop right outside the door. Although I rented a car, it was a waste other than getting back and forth to the airport. As everyone knows, finding inexpensive parking in San Francisco is nearly impossible, so unless you're on business (which I was) and really need a car, save the expense and take a taxi back and forth to the airport since MUNI takes you to all the major attractions in and around the city. From the time I checked in until check out, the service was absolutely impeccable. And the BEDS! OMG, I have never gotten a good nights sleep on my first night until I laid my head down at the Stanford COurt. I know that Marriott recently upgraded the bedding i all its' hotels, but this hotel must have the top of the line mattress because I just sunk in and was out like a light in no time and didn't wake up until 6 the next morning, which is MAJOR! You can't go wrong with the Stanford Court if you're headed to San Francisco. You will definitely leave your heart in this place!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC HOTEL IN A GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: monte5
Reviews.Content: very pleased we stayed at this hotel--california street-- cable car stop--Rochelle at check-in was very pleasant--Ric Lee and Shah the Concierge's were very knowledable and helpful-- we ate dinner and breakfast at Aurea[hotel restaurant]--very satisfied --we would definitely stay again at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location, really comfy beds, quiet room, gorgeous view, and a duvet!”
Reviews.Author: lasanto2002
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the corner of California and Powell Streets, so you may catch the cable car right out front either to the Financial District for work, or to Fishermans Wharf for fun and great seafood. You may purchase a 3 day pass at the desk for $20, or pay $5 per ride on the cable car. Bring good walking shoes, as the hill is steep if you don't decide to take the cable car. Our room looked out to Union Square, and in the evening, we could watch the fog drift in and the city light up. Despite being right on the cable car route, the room was really quiet, and I slept wonderfully on the really comfortable bed every night. I certainly hated to leave the duvet behind, as it was warm and cozy without being heavy. There was even a towel warmer in the room for heated towels - look for a small switch on the bottom right, as there are no signs, and we didn't find it until the last day. Staff was always helpful, and pointed us to a great little nearby neighborhood restaurant that we would never have found on our own - the Nob Hill Cafe. Go early if you don't want to wait, though, as they don't take reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: missdanielle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very professional and classy. We had nothing but great things to say about the Standford Court! The location is right outside of a cable car line, minutes from Union and Washington Square. The resturant inside is very yummy! Best Moijtos in town! Rooms are a little small, but very comfy beds! Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Really SUPERB... I mean REALLY. Best hotel experience in years plus FINE dining!”
Reviews.Author: Hassiman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming to San Francisco on our Anniversary since our honeymoon 34 years ago. We have stayed at many hotels in the Bay area. We had not been back to the Stanford Court since its renovation last year. We were very pleasantly surprised by the many improvments in decor but more importantly the service and staff were friendly, helpful and the service was the best I have ever experienced. The Hotels is located in the heart of everything with ChinaTown, Union Square and North Beach just a short walk from the front door. The room was spotless, I had some degree of trepidation because of the current outbreak of bedbugs but we expexperienced NO problems whatsoever. The new restaurant AUREA was not only reasonably priced but the food was superb. I talked with an number of other guests and their experiences were similar. On my next trip I will without question eat more of my meals in the hotel as the food at AUREA far surpassed all other dining experiences I had while in San Francisco. I do not hasitate to give the Stanford Court my hearty reccomendation.... and kudos to the staff and management. Attached is a picture of the view from my hotel room at sunrise... Spectacular

Reviews.Title: “We're in the business to make money”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: That's what the guy working in the business center told us. We had 2 packages to ship via FedEx and have an account with them. Whenever a pickup is scheduled, an additional $4 per package is added by FedEx, which is understandable. The guy at the business center proceeds to tell us that in addition to that fee, we have to pay him $5 per package, since they are in the business of making money. Those were his exact words. I called FedEx and they said that they already tack on a fee ($8 total for our 2 packages) and under no circumstance to pay an additional $10 to the hotel. If you have stuff to ship, you're better off just walking down the street to the FedEx location yourself. It would have been $18 extra to ship our package through the hotel, which to me is outrageous. Other than that, the hotel is in a great location, but that's about it. We needed a taxi for the airport on our last day and the concierge harassed us every single time we passed by his desk about booking a town car instead. It got so annoying that we would intentionally avoid walking by him since we had no interest in booking a town car when the taxi suited us perfectly and was $20 cheaper. Oh, and the wifi? $14.95 per day, which is ridiculous, give it's 2010 and free wifi is readily available at many hotspots around the city. We passed many hotels while walking through the city that offered free wi fi. This isn't one of them. But, they're in the business of making money so it's ok. Keep that in mind when you book your room, everything is extra here! Overall, the hotel is in a great area, with nice rooms. The staff, however, is very pushy and not at all friendly. Funny thing is, they don't see any of that money they claim the hotel is in the business of making and probably make minimum wage themselves. There were several other hotels on this block. I saw a Fairmont across the street and another really nice one next door, but I'm blanking on the name. Unless you get a deal on Priceline, stay elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: pygar2007
Reviews.Content: Cannot get over what a bargain this place is, esp on Nob Hill. The rooms are very nice, great bed and the linens are esp nice. Nice bath/closet/dressing area. For some reason I just dislike the usual armoires most places have so this for me was very nice, like being at home. Check in took a little long as we had requested 2 double beds and none were available so we were "upgraded" to a king on the top floor with a to-die-for 180 degree view from Coit Tower through downtown with the Transamerica pyramid right smack in your face. Beautiful both day and night. Coffee was delivered in less than 5 minutes of ordering in the morning and very good. The windows open so there is always fresh air. So much to see and do all within minutes of the hotel. There are a number of parking garages nearby that are much less than the hotels. The doormen/valet guys are very nice about letting a friend park in the courtyard for 15-20 minutes, just give them a nice tip and you can come and go very nicely. The bar is great--many different areas to sit depending on your needs. From lounge chairs to sofas and nook areas to different height bars. We chose the lower height bar which is nice if you are shorter. The drinks are terrific and bartenders very nice. If you smoke, they have the nicest smoking area I have ever seen at a hotel--in the courtyard, covered, real furniture and you can listen to the fountain. Overall the Stanford Court is perhaps the best bargain in the city--a lot of bang for your buck as the Mark H next door and the Fairmont across the street are easily a couple hundred more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: channelkatz
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is such a beautiful City but problems the state faces financially seem to be taking toll. I'll describe later in the review..... The Stanford Court is a very nice Hotel, centrally located within steps of China Town. Our room was spacious and very comfortable but we didn't have much of a view, and although the hotel didn't seem full, they wanted additional money for an upgrade.... I declined. We've been to San Francisco before, and like this location because it's NOT the congested touristy area of Fisherman's Warf but close enough to still make a quick visit. The Lobby Bar was great, and we looked forward to relaxing (with a beverage) before heading to the room. The appetizers were REALLY good. If you're tired of all the fancy SF food.... Try the sweet and spicy wings, or A Burger with Fries. Be aware of higher taxes in California (8.5% sales tax), and additional taxes or fees within the City. The Hotel Concierge recommended a restaurant to us and kindly made a reservation. The food was good and the service was super but when we received the bill the Restaurant added an additional 4.5% (healthcare Tax?) on the the statement. We were unable to take advantage of the streetcar because they were always full. It appears (to me) that the City hasn't provided enough transportation. Unless you wait in line at Market Street or fisherman's Warf, it's unlikely that you'll get on. We were offered a car to borrow (from friends) that live in the city but the cost of parking made it prohibitive.

Reviews.Title: “Losing their touch”
Reviews.Author: junodee
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Stanford Court at least once every year since 2006. We know the hotel and the room layout options. Which is why I made a point of calling and speaking to a reservations clerk to expressly confirm the availability of a high floor room with a view and 2 double beds for my family of three people. Unfortunately, we arrived around midnight on a Friday night (after a very long flight from the East Coast) to be told that our reservation for 2 beds was "only a request" and the desk clerk then directed us to a handicapped accessible room on a low floor, no view, with a queen bed that turned out to have literally no space for a roll away. When we called the desk from the room and said that if we put a roll away in the room, someone would have to step onto the rollaway bed in order to get to the bathroom, the desk clerk tried to tell us that all of the rooms were the same size --and he said no other larger rooms were available in the entire hotel. When we pushed back and said we'd stayed there before (and knew there were larger rooms), he told us he'd call us back--and yet left us hanging in the room, with our luggage and the somewhat embarrassed bell staff for 15 minutes of awkward conversation. Eventually, since it was now about 12:45 am and our child was exhausted, we called back and he found us a room, which, big surprise, was on a high floor, had a good view, included a king bed and had sufficient space for a rollaway bed. Very disheartening to be told first that no such rooms existed--only to be given one roughly 45 minutes later after arguing...The room was a bit dirty (there were loose hairs on the floor and someone's receipt was still sitting on a chair), but it was fine. Given that it was a weekend, the hotel was very busy, the concierge seemed overwhelmed (we had to ask twice to get all of the information that we needed) and in the end, the staff seemed intent on just getting through the barrage of guests until the weekend was over...Indeed on Saturday, the maid literally did not come to clean the room until 5:30 pm. And then on Sunday afternoon they cleaned the carpets in the hallways and our room smelled of carpet cleaner for much of the last night. I could hear the desk staff talking about the smell as I walked by the front desk--they also thought it was terrible. I have always liked this hotel in the past. The location near Union Square is outstanding. There is a great playground nearby (and another in Chinatown, just a few blocks away). And the views are great. But this visit did not meet my expectations (from past visits). Based on this last visit, I would not recommend staying here on a weekend or coming in late at night. They are fine when they are not overwhelmed with people, but their social and customer skills seem to be under too much stress when their capacity is close to full.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not best for families”
Reviews.Author: mcdb1963
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and my son. Needless to say, we prefer having 2 beds. I was told at check-in that rooms with 2 beds were scarce and we waited for a few hours to finally obtain one. Our room faced a courtyard. If you want a view from the top of Nob Hill, realize that half their rooms face a courtyard with no view. I called the front desk and another person told me that all rooms with 2 beds faced the courtyard. The next day I asked a third person, who stated that some rooms with 2 beds have a view, but they were scarce and were already accounted for due to coupling of rooms. I still don't know what the true explanation is, but just know that it's nearly impossible to get a room with 2 beds with any view. The rooms are nice, but are oriented differently than most current hotel rooms. The front doors open right next to the bed. If you're sleeping next to the door, you may hear hallway noise. The bathroom door also opens right into the room instead of a foyer, and the doors are essentially wood shutters. They're not very soundproof. The location is good, but the hill is very steep returning from Chinatown or Union Square. There is free internet for 24 hours if you log in the lobby. This continues up in your room. After 24 hours, you'll be prompted to pay for internet access in your room, but you can simply go back to the lobby, log in again and have another 24 hours of access in your room. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in San Francisco/Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: pikapptcu
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here multiple times and have made this my hotel of choice when syating downtown. Hotel is away from the tourist traps so that is nice. Also has a cable car stop right outside the front door, also a bit of a drawback if you have a room on the outside with the ringing bells. Very close walk to Chinatown.....I highly recommend R&G Lounge (excellent food at reasonable prices). The rooms are nicely renovated. They have a lounge for Reward members. Service is top notch. I usually get a rate around $150/nt here and you can't beat it. Valet parking is expensive, but if you get a great rate then it all balances out. Stay here, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy little hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kingtrips
Reviews.Content: I was at the Renaissance Stanford Court for a business meeting. The hotel staff was very helpful and the rooms small, but well appointed. The location in Nob Hill was great. My only regret was that I was unable to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Top of Nob Hill”
Reviews.Author: cityhotelsightseeing
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights at the start of my trip to the USA. The Stanford Court is a beautifully presented hotel. The rooms are very comfortable (with the exception of the lounge chair, which isn't) and stylish. The location on top of Nob hill, is very good- intersecting with two cable car lines. The hotel driveway features a beautiful stained glass dome and a lounge for waiting for tours/cabs etc- a great idea which more hotels should adapt.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Improved and Great Rate + View”
Reviews.Author: ECMedbooks
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Stanford Court for a conference which was held at the Mark Hopkins International next door. The rate was about $60 less ($169) and the view was equally as impressive. The hotel has gone through recent renovations (you can kind of tell walking through the hallway with the paint job). Our room looked modern and upgraded (flat screen TV, with multiple A/V outlets, two phones, towel heater, flexible shower head). We had a room with a view of the bay which was amazing. There is free WiFi in the lobby which was fast. The operator was very helpful with any issues and courteous as well. The location of course is amazing, Chinatown and Union Square are within walking distance (though you have a steep hill to go down on and then up later) as well as the Ferry Building. All in all I was really pleased with my stay. Only negatives would be. There bath towels are really cheap feeling and could use an upgrade to match the hotel upgrade. There is no fridge that you can use in the room - though they will bring you one very quickly if you want - still slight inconvenience. And just make sure you don't touch the mini-bar because its weighted sensors (wasn't really marked clearly that was the case), but we didn't have an issue with this. Oh! And the Cable Cars go through California and Powell so there is street noise - but you kind of get used to it and you feel like you're in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: thegallons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were on our only vacation we were going to take this year due to budget restrictions. This was our last night of our road trip from Southern California up to Oregon and back. We found a great deal for a room in at this hotel and saw that it had good reviews and was in a decent part of town (right next to the Mark Hopkins, close enough we could have used their wireless internet had it been free). When we arrived at the hotel we were pleasantly greeted by the Valet who promptly removed out luggage from the car and gave us a stub for car retrieval. We walked through the large glass doors into the lobby and we invited into a large room with marble floors, granite counter tops and smiles on the employees faces. We gave them out last name and they began to check up in to their system, all was going well until they saw that we were not paying the full price for the room but rather had gotten a discounted rate through another site. Then the mood changed. We were not offered assistance up to our room by a bellman, we were pointed in the direction of the elevators and given the top floor with the room farthest from the elevator. When the person at the desk handed me our keys I had noticed she had written our room number on the envelope, standard practice, but I also noted that she wrote how much we paid for the room on the same side of the envelope. Why? So everyone would know that I am a saver and refuse to pay full price for a room in a town that is already overpriced? Regardless, my wife and I made our way to our room which seemed to be small for the money paid . A queen bed, 2 night stands, desk and office chair, table for 1, arm chair, and an over sized entertainment center/mini bar, all in a room that was about 14'x14'. At least the TV was big enough to see from the bed, probably 40"-42". The bathroom was nice, although really only enough room for one, and the water pressure was very unstable, but nice. That night my wife and I had tickets to see Wicked (an absolutely amazing production, see it if you haven't), so while the wife was getting ready I decided to watch some TV. Turned it on and got the typical hotel channel, flipped through some HD channels and thought, oh this is nice, it will be just like home ESPN, ESPN2, TNT, TBS, all the other wonderful HD channels, again, let down. Only 4 HD channels, none of the others worked, few of the other "analog" channels worked. No HBO, no HBO HD. All I could think was, here I am in a rather pricey 4 star hotel with a valet, and I can't watch have the channels I watched last night in another hotel that cost half as much and the room was twice as big. So I decided I'll just go online and watch some shows Hulu or something. I open our laptop, connect to the local wireless and up comes a message, "In order to use the wireless internet you must purchase a 24 hour business pass for $15.95." Excuse me? I'm paying $50 a night for parking, plus the cost of my room, and now you want me to pay another $15.95 to use the internet. I don't think so, I stayed at a Best Western and got free wireless and paid 1/3 of what I'm paying you. Needless to say, I will not be staying at this hotel ever again. I will probably not be returning to SF anytime soon either, it's not clean, I didn't feel safe walking around town in broad daylight, and the cost of an over night stay is ludicrous.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrstphrwarwick
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 nights at stanford court in san francisco fantastic hotel great staff good location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price for comfort, luxury, awesome location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: loopysis
Reviews.Content: My daughter's 16th birthday gift was a trip to San Francisco to see Idina Menzel sing with the San Francisco Symphony. As is my modus operandi I immediately went to upromise.com to click on priceline.com (because priceline.com gives you 2% back for college with every transaction) to purchase a hotel room. I wasn't too familiar with San Francisco so I took a "nearest to symphony" approach. I chose Nob Hill area, 4 star hotel and, as is my way, tried $88/night. I was delighted to find that priceline had accepted my request. We left in early July for a 4 day trip to San Francisco. We arrived early at the hotel and the front desk worked at getting rooms next to each other (not an option on the priceline site). They told us they'd call us when our rooms were ready and we went out for our journey. The hotel has a great big interactive touch screen map where you can find restaurants, tourist destinations, etc so we chose a restaurant a few blocks away. Sadly, the restaurant was closed and we were a tad disappointed as we continued our stroll in search of a restaurant. Within minutes we found ourselves in Chinatown. AWESOME. Had no idea Chinatown and Nob Hill were so close to each other! Had no idea Nob Hill is so close to everything. We came back to the hotel and the valet was always Johnny on the Spot in getting our doors opened and us on our way to our room. Please note - in retrospect I would never rent a car again in San Francisco. It was convenient to be able to drive to/from the airport...but there is no real need for a car. The driving is insane, the available transportation is varied and quite available and, get this...the parking at the hotel was FIFTY DOLLARS A DAY. Plus the tips for the valet. Plus the cost of a rental car. WAY TOO EXPENSIVE. And very unnecessary. The elevators are close to the front desk and the rooms are wonderful. They are very large and roomy with great oversized chairs for watching the gorgeous flat screen tele. I usually don't sleep well in hotel beds but I slept like a log in these incredibly comfy beds. The bathrooms were nice but I'm always disappointed that a 4 star hotel can't have a bigger bathtub. Maybe that's just me. They use yummy Aveda products (which we pilfered) and their coffeemaker made quite a decent cup of coffee. The last night we ordered room service and the food was delicious. A must see if you are staying on Nob Hill -- regardless of our religious persuasion -- check out the Grace Cathedral. It's mammoth and truly jaw dropping. There is some good mojo in that church...and if you go in, why don't you light a candle and pray for your family, your country, the earth. ;) All in all, this hotel comes highly recommended. Just DON'T rent a car. - I deleted a star from Value because of that little nugget. Later, peeps! Happy travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Renassance Stanford could not have been any better !”
Reviews.Author: DavidLynwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Stanford Court for 4 nights last week with wife and 2 teenaged daughters. You won't find a better location- on Nob Hill where the cable car lines cross. The service was incredible. As you walked into the hotel you were greeted personally and the front desk opened the elevators for you as you approached them so there was no wait. Incredible, friendly staff- helpful with storing bags, getting van to airport quickly, extra towels, anything we needed. All this for $129 a night in San Francisco !!!!!! Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: DBWilson
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Marriotts and am an elite member. I have to say, this was the BEST Marriott I have ever stayed at. The location was beautiful, atop Nob Hill, the staff was amazing, so friendly and accommodating, the restaurant had a simple and elegant menu which was delicious and served with perfect service, the rooms were nicely decorated, clean and had huge bathrooms. What more could you ask for? I found the location to be great, just jump on a cable car and you can go almost anywhere. Two cable cars stop right at your door, the California and the Powell. You can also connect to the buses from the cable car. I slept the best I have ever slept in my life. The bed and linens were very nice and comfortable. I loved waking up to a sunny view of Twin Peaks from my room and the cheery "ding ding" of the cable car 8 stories down (honestly you could barely hear it). The staff greeted us by name each morning and evening with a friendly smile and hello. Whatever we needed was no trouble at all. I can't wait to go back! Simply Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: specialed08
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location. Two trolley cars pass at this intersection, chinatown down one hill, the bay down another. This was my first trip to california, I really enjoyed it. This hotel had a great staff, and comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Old School San Fran Meets Modern Design”
Reviews.Author: sandk06
Reviews.Content: I'm a marriott snob (last year, I stayed over 140 nights in marriott hotels) and am pairing down my travel considerably. Consequently, I'm even more picky about my hotel choices. I really like the Stanford Court, from the great fitness center to the classic style that comes out in little touches in the rooms. My room faced California street, so I had some cable car noise, but that's ok, I knew that going in (front desk alerted me and gave me the chance to change) and I had a beautiful view of the city especially solid in the morning and night. The cable car stop right out the door makes getting to the embarcadero very easy as well. Beds are super comfortable and sheets are nice and soft. My only ding here is the shower heads which aren't very high; I have to squat down to wash my hair (I'm 6'1") and I'm no giant. Outside of that, I really like the class of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel with Fresh Look”
Reviews.Author: brmusicman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 6 nights in June, 2010; the trip was a combination of business and leisure. I was very impressed with the property -- in a city where most of the major chain properties are very big hotels, this property offered the benefits of a chain with the charm of a smaller, boutique property. From seeing into various rooms during housekeeping, it appears that the rooms at this property can vary in size and layout, as is often the case at historic properties. Half of the rooms face an interior courtyard, and half face the streets of San Francisco. I hit it lucky with my room -- my windows faced Powell Street, and I had a fantastic view of the city. This is certainly an advantage of the hotel's location atop Nob Hill! Although I could hear the cable cars in my room, the noise from the street did not negatively affect my sleep. My room was good-sized; it had a queen bed (most of the beds here appear to be queens, not kings -- fine by me, but maybe problematic for some), a nice sitting area, a desk, and a large bathroom. Everything was in great condition; the hotel had clearly recently undergone major renovation. I thought the room had a great color scheme (creams and golds) and stylish decor. The renovation did a good job of allowing the property to keep its historic charm while giving it a modern look. The room also had great conveniences for a business traveler: lots of outlets, including by the bed; reading lights built into the headboard, etc. I LOVED the bed. It is one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever stayed in. Truly wonderful -- soft sheets, padded mattress, warm and cozy...hard to get out of! I wish this hotel would share its bed-making secrets with other properties around the country. I had access to the concierge lounge. It was oustanding -- a good-sized breakfast in the morning, appetizers in the evening, and a dessert collection late-night, along with drinks. The lounge space was large and the service was warm and friendly. The lounge also offers great views of San Francisco. I thought the hotel's service hit the mark. My check-in was quick and efficient. The bellmen consistently opened the doors as I came and went from the hotel. When I needed a car to the airport at an obscenely early hour, the concierge arranged one for me. The hotel's location is great for getting around San Francisco -- it's a short walk down to Chinatown and on to North Beach, a short walk down to the financial district, a short walk down to Union Square -- I really enjoyed the easy access to various parts of the city. Notice one thing, though -- all of those places are DOWN from the hotel. That means that you have to go back UP to get back to the hotel -- and San Francisco's hills will give you a workout! No complaints...just bring your walking shoes. If I had to offer any criticisms, it might be a small-ish lobby -- it was in essence a front desk, concierge desk, and elevators, with a restaurant off to the side that had a pretty open feel. The hotel's elevators could also be very slow, particularly during busy hours. Very small things in the scheme of things. Highly impressive property. And, best of all, very affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located for most points in the city”
Reviews.Author: Generic90
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property while spending the Memorial Day weekend visiting family in San Francisco. This was my first stay at this hotel; I selected it based on rate and on previous experience with Marriott properties. There is a historic kind of feel to the hotel that makes it feel unique in comparison to standard stays. However, once you step inside, there is a modern/contemporary vibe that provides a nice balance. It appears the lobby and surrounding area has recently been renovated; the full-size, touch-screen, interactive maps were very handy. Customer service is very important to me, and throughout the duration of my stay was outstanding. Everyone - valets, concierge, bartenders, housekeepers, and front desk staff - were always polite and friendly, and responsive to all guests. I got the feeling that if I had a problem, it would be dealt with promptly. A particular note on customer service had to do with the newspaper delivery, which I have as a request as a Marriott Rewards member. Per my profile request, I received a Wall Street Journal at my door on the Saturday of my stay. On the Sunday and Monday, I received copies of the San Francisco Chronicle in lieu of the WSJ non-publication days, with a handwritten note attached to the paper indicating that they hoped the "replacement" paper was not an inconvenience (it certainly wasn't). I have been to other Marriott properties where such a "replacement" was not provided - though I do not demand it - so it was a nice, unexpected touch. The room I had was on the 6th floor right near the corner of California and Powell Streets. From a pure tourist perspective, this was a wonderful location, as all the cable car lines intersected there. There was some ambient street noise, but the loudest of it - and it wasn't very loud at all - was the rumble of the cable cars and their bells as they passed by the hotel. It was a very pleasant sound, and at night it was very quiet. The windows were somewhat small, but provided wonderful vistas of the Bay, the Financial District, and to the area around the Giants ballpark. As for the room itself, it was well appointed.
